Y3m_siSenGtaKYLmYiqWig.text: One of my favorite places to go for lunch. Has a real dive bar feel with a Viking theme. Service is pretty good even when busy, they are always friendly. I usually go for breakfast food but recently they stopped serving that for lunch. VERY disappointing as their breakfast was a gift from Odin himself. The rest of the menu is good so I managed to move on although now I don't visit as much. The bangers and mash is excellent as well as the Norwegian burger. They would get five stars were it not for the breakfast issue(if you work here and are reading this please bring it back for lunch) but all in all a great place to eat.

0UmgHjPPLR9hNaa_mGKklw.text: Being a bit of a long walk from my place uptown I had never really even thought of checking this place out till now.  I'm glad I finally made the trek.  Tucked away in Brevard Court, which might I say, is really a cool little niche of uptown, Valhalla is a nice addition.    Exposed brick interior with the majority of the interior being the bar gives this place a nice neighborhood pub feel.  Combine that with the food and you've got a pretty decent place to grab a pint and a good meal.  I enjoyed the turkey meatballs and side salad when I went but I really want to go back and try some of the other dishes, specifically some of the breakfast items.  Speaking of the breakfast items, they serve it all day long.    Parking for this place is non existent I'm pretty sure, you'll have to find street parking or a lot or a parking deck nearby.

ROVF3gP0l7lDcQnPNZzGiQ.text: As soon as we sat down, the table was sticky.   Our waitress was extremely rude to us. She brought my friend the wrong order, and when I tried to tell her she held up one finger and then left for 5 minutes. The food was awful but the service was much worse. They were out of fries (you're a pub??) and the Drunken Chicken sandwich had a piece of chicken about half the size of the bread, so not much of a sandwich there (and no honey mustard on it, as it was supposed to have). The tater tots, we picked apart, and there was NO potato in them - just breading.   Meanwhile, I asked for a box 10 minutes ago and am writing this review waiting for it instead of being on my way.   There is a nice park across from it.

R3ZLe3W-d0i6PzWvrHRCdQ.text: Surprisingly good! We were hungry at 11 pm so we walked from our hotel to this pub!  I ordered the sweet and sour sauteed shrimp as a wrap and it was very good! My friend had the veggie burger and she could not stop raving about it!

yJgGfz0fWOHaABEf5GLfHg.text: Amazing food choices for such a small place you would think it would be just for food but it is very interesting unique dishes must go here and try all of their dishes food choices for such a small place you would think it would be just for food but it is very interesting unique dishes must go here and try all of their dishes

ufUcivH7zMZy-Ak9Ys3U_A.text: Came here for Sunday Brunch with the hubby and we were pleasantly surprised. Sat at the high top by the window and ordered the Bloody Mary special for $5...very good and spicy. Asked bartender, Bob if we could watch the race and he changed it right away...very nice guy and very attentive. I ordered the Vafler which is a Norwegian waffle with fresh fruit and homemade whipped cream...wow!!! It was so good I didn't even need syrup. Hubby got the steak and egg burrito and said it was good too. He said it could've had a little more egg but still good.    We're native Charlotteans and walked by here many times and finally gave it a try. Been to their sister bar Hooligans many times and love it too. So glad we decided to give Valhalla a try. We'll definitely come back.

edix-_JXRjCh2AQDJGnviw.text: Recently opened by one of the owners of the popular soccer bar Courtyard Hooligans, Valhalla Pub and Eatery gives those looking for great food in a great atmosphere more options, at more times of the day, than ever in Brevard Court.  Located in the front corner of Brevard Court along Church Street, Valhalla has the feel of the great hall of Odin from Norse mythology with it's custom built, dark wood bar to the horned helmets and axes adorning the walls.  The menu takes it's queues from the Scandinavian theme with items like a meatball sandwich with house made meatballs in a Norsk brown gravy (think BIG Swedish meatballs in a less creamy gravy) and the Norsk Burger with it's beef and pork patty with Jarlsberg cheese.  If you're more local in your tastes there are standard burgers and salads as well.  But once you get inside Valhalla would you really want to upset Odin and eat the veggie burger?  No, I didn't think so.  The bar is fully stocked for mixed drinks and wine, as well as a good collection of beers on tap and bottled.  Into darts and pool?  Both will be available in the back room with it's 2 TV's to help you stay up to date in the world of sports.  Overall this is a great addition to the ever expanding options in the historic Brevard Court, and be it lunch time or night time Valhalla will be there to welcome you!

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

WVOD2Jb3ZspZ7Z8jMVwxmA.text: Went in on a Saturday and they were busy with a wait. We both had the Norwegian burger which was "Their blend of beef & pork, gaufrette potatoes, melted Jarlsberg, red onion & Norsk sauce--topped with fried egg" The meat was more like a frozen oval ground chuck dried out thin patty. No taste at all and about a 1/4 in thick. All their sandwiches are served on a sub roll. The potatoes mashed were excellent. The food was presented very nice. Beer selection was great as well as the service. Place has a pub atmosphere. We would go back for drinks but not for the food.

paIoHT-COrS9Xf8oEK-Blw.text: Went here tonight for the first time. The staff was great...very friendly and sincere. Had the fish and chips and the fish was excellent. Cool atmosphere. Will add it to my list of regular places.

Z35eUjUFen_VAPUg6_7E8g.text: Super service! Great local beer selection!!! Just enough tvs... I had the black n blue chicken wrap. It was delicious. My date had the black n blue steak salad. Perfection. Highly recommend this place.

K6og3n_0Hvbz4PwsBF9Dwg.text: I'm not sure what all the rave reviews are all about?  We went on a Wednesday evening, it was fairly crowded compared to the New Orleans place across the way so we decided to stop in for some food. Service was pretty decent, place was really cute. Reminds me of a country irish pub, dark and cozy. It seems to be Norwegian themed but very few actual Norwegian dishes (which would have made it really interesting)  I had the fish and chips and my boyfriend got the wings. He said they were lukewarm and unappealing.  My fish was okay, at least not soggy. Both of us had fries which were not warm at all.  Definitely 5 star atmosphere and probably great during a game but not a restaurant by any stretch of the imagination.

qq3i8T3uMLN7FKGUAiwhOg.text: Great atmosphere, service, food, and tap selection!  That, and it has Viking stuff on the walls, and not the crappy NFL team, the Vikings, but Ragnar Vikings!!!

l53utHcZJS2nwNCeWgrSgA.text: Stopped by here last night and was pleasantly surprised!!  It is located right at the corner of Church and Brevard Court (which has nothing to do with Brevard Street!)  It looks like there is parking at lots and on the street.  During the week you can walk straight through the court from Tryon but they lock it up after hours and you can only access the court from Church.  You can also sit at the outside tables in the court - good for the smokers.  I had a margarita on the rocks - service was fast and friendly.  Very cozy place with a bar and high and low top tables - additionally booths in the main dining area.  I ordered the Swedish Hash - they serve breakfast all day!  Fun!  The Swedish hash was very good - eggs over hash.  I had mine with hot sauce.  Very normal breakfast experience - I would probably try the meatballs next time.  The boyfriend had those and they were AWESOME!!    Will definitely be back.  Thanks guys!

z0C_-fvzBOWRiFsQw9M5Gg.text: I wasn't able to give this place a five simply because we didn't have the opportunity to eat. We did look over the menu and can't wait to come back to Charlotte and dine here.   That being said we stumbled across this gem literally.  As one other person mentioned service was a bit slow but well worth the quality. I had the best Bloody Mary ever!!!  The fresh squeezed drinks ROCKED too.   This place is a must visit for people visiting Charlotte and want to get away from the "city" without leaving the city.

y0ILUPMdjpIxENQ2VQvahw.text: Food was good! The shrimp wrap was delicious as well as the grilled cheese. They have really good thick cut bacon. The Bloody Mary was one of the best I've had. It was spicy and the mix is made in house. It also comes with a Cajun shrimp, a pickled green bean and a pickled asparagus.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best Bloody Mary!

HoYfMZZZ-ElZlKkg91Ao3w.text: Delicious food - loved the pulled pork quesadilla - and the Birdsong Jalapeno IPA is my new favorite beer!

WtBBJrg-dhTZ_1_lNVoPOQ.text: Every time I have gone, they have had live music which is usually really good.  Their food is great for bar food. While it is a small bar, it is connected to a wine bar next door so you can get great wine from there.

27o7i7h4VJ_V0QLipjJ5fA.text: Fun, energetic staff and a satisfyingly eclectic menu designed to please. Our first visit was late-night after drinks at one of the other bars in the the Brevard Court alley. We had a beer and a couple of shots as a nightcap, poured by a friendly bartender with patience for our antics.   In the morning (well, it was actually close to noon) we returned for brunch. The sandwiches and fish and chips coming out of the kitchen were huge and amazing-looking, but we were there for breakfast foods. I had the Swedish Hash, which was WAY too much to eat, but delicious with bits of meat interspersed throughout the crispy potatoes and covered with egg. The bread was particularly good too. They even made us a pot of coffee (desperately needed).  I hope to return to Charlotte one day, if for no other reason than to stop in and try some meatballs and maybe a Norsk Burger.

7JRFQadToxVTnqgcGSSmeQ.text: This a great place, close to the office.  What makes it great is the staff.  They do a good job on pub grub and the execution is excellent.  Dishes like the Fish and Chips stand out.  That said, it's a mark of a good pub when they know your name and what you like--that is good service.

7r6gmFQ8zRAcRVaVNP5Kfw.text: If you love to get an idea--a taste of Scandinavian food--then this is a great and charming place. It's definitely worth a visit if you're in the neighborhood!

W6GDiBHtTdD9TXMLCvxRpQ.text: Here's a well kept secret...  The kitchen at Valhalla is absolutely excellent. They provide high quality ingredients and great service.   Look over the menu to see what type of food is offered up. If this appeals to you, order with high confidence. Someone who runs Vallhalla knows what they are doing!

_JKixBo9Qx5xPPO_0W0U6A.text: The food is OK but the service is AWEFUL!! Not sure what it is with the servers but they seem to always have a chip on their shoulder. I have lived in Charlotte 6 years and periodically try to give this location a place holder specifically for it being a soccer bar uptown but the service above all is always terrible. Not worth the long wait to even get food and the unwarranted attitude to even try the to establish a longer and frustrating tab in the end. Wait but if you encounter one of the male staff, you MIGHT get civilized service ...good luck but I advise you go past

GCY7H7GW5AabLMbO00rVNQ.text: Wow, where to start. First, Valhalla is located on the street but it's apart of an alleyway with cute food places and outdoor seating with lights streaming across the tops of the buildings. The inside is super cute with exposed brick and rustic wood. Second, the Bloody Mary was amazing. A little spicy but just right. Third, the food. Omg the food. I got the Eggs Benedict which has salmon in it (pictured) and the home fries were the best I've had in my life. The waitress was also awesome and created a new drink they're trying from scratch and gave us tasters. Such a great place we just stumbled upon but will be back as much as I can!!!

cYAEYpNC-YgpmrFlaWJCyw.text: Came here one afternoon after I stopped in at Hooligans for a quick bite to eat. We were seated right away and our food came out quick. Beers were cold and the wings were good. I also had the cheesesteak sandwich with waffle fries and that very good as well. I actually came here with the intensions of getting the Norwegian Burger after hearing good things and never got a chance to try it. This is a great little place to come to grab a bite if your in the area. The service is fantastic and the food was solid! I look forward to coming back here and trying a few more things that caught my eye.   **Please note - alcohol was consumed at Hooligans prior to eating here lol. I will most certainly update my review if my next few experiences here aren't as good.

0CyXaiS9m3IIX--8mOT19w.text: As someone whose of Swedish decent, this place was amazing. I had the Laghertha's Turkey Sandwich and for $10, it was unbelievable. House roasted pulled turkey, sliced green apple, cheddar cheese, thick cut bacon & lingonberry aioli on country toast. Wow!!!  Also, we came on a cold day and we're surprised with homemade chicken noodle soup. Had a bowl as an appetizer and it could not have been made better by my own mother.   The atmosphere and service were also second to know. My favorite lunch spot in Charlotte.

sbuXZCOEe88tH_jFeAdQlg.text: What a fun place with great food! Decor is "modern Viking" (which is its own fun), the menu has great options and The service is great. Definitely glad to have stopped by while at a conference this weekend.

MJnB_C5bAzbdhmab8uF8jg.text: Beer is cold, patio/alley is great when there is a baseball or panthers game or soccer on TV. Normally an international crowd. It's a bar.. with bar food.. don't expect anything more

ZZ6JLd6RXOFnI7pfGZo3vg.text: Valhalla is one of the few places uptown - or in all of Charlotte - that will give you an authentic pub atmosphere.  The wine list is good enough to keep me happy, and the beer selection doesn't disappoint.  Their food is better than your average pub for bar snacks. Its a solid after work or pre ball game choice.

ZnkoCxxIytDIvuRMwruR_g.text: Paul's Yelp Elite Rating: 3.25 Stars  Third time here yet my first Yelp review. I got to quit doing this! OK, focus Paul, focus....  Met a buddy who used to work at my company, so I decided to check this place out again as it has been a while. So I got the Nobleman "Salad" with Drunken Chicken. I'm thinking to myself, hum, I had a big breakfast, so get a light salad, right?  NOT! WRONG! DON'T GO HERE! The plate is GY-NOR-MUS (translation - Friggin HUGE) as it's filled with DEEP FRIED CHICKEN Strip-like thingys....almost looked like Fish and Chips! Upon first glance, I believe I soiled my pants thinking, how the $&*&!^@#$*! am I EVER going to eat all this? Well I didn't, and I hated to waste this, but I did.  So onto the taste. Well, it TASTED good. My issue is that it was like 70% breading and 30% chicken, or something like that. Pub Cook - you put WAYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY too much batter on the chicken. There is NO need to do that! It can be just as tasty with a LIGHT dip of the batter. Shake it off first....do something. Too much batter makes waste, which is what happened to me here.  The "salad" portion was good, with spinach lettuce and egg, red onions and mushrooms, and of course....that thing that makes all "healthy" salads unhealthy....BACON!  Ranch dressing was good.....but you'll need more than one little cup for this monster plate. In fact, ask for THREE IF you plan on eating the whole plate.  NOTE TO YOURSELF: IF you can eat the entire plate of this drunken chicken, immediately check into the Overeaters Anonymous of Charlotte location! That's my story and I'm sticking to it!  This place is really more of a bar but their food is overall pretty good. Three stars for the over-breading of the chicken.....and somewhat slow service (they got slammed right after we walked in).  I'd still recommend this place, especially for a drink after work. Small but nicely selected beers on tap.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Drunken Chicken Salad

zxLTur2e52BJLZypMnor7g.text: Pretty good last minute pick I came up with for the friends and family.  According to my wife the best ever salmon Benedict she ever had. Then she let me sample and I would say the same.  Then we got waffle fries fully loaded.the fries were good but the fully loaded lacked the fully part. The cheese barely covered the home top part.the ham and bacon toppings were as little skinny. But the fries stayed crispy not soggy so that was good.  I got the Philly cheeses steak no peppers.and the bread wad really good and fresh. The streak inside was fully covered with cheese. So that part was good I added mushrooms but that was a little lost inside.I had some but not enough as an add on.  Our friends had the fish tacos and fish and chips and liked then. So over all success.  I don't think I would come back to this place just yet there are lots of places to try in this area.

T-AfeKlAV8Z2PL0TlacC6g.text: Tourist visiting the area. Decided to check this place out because of it's proximity to the BB&T stadium and good reviews. I was not disappointed. Service was excellent. Was seated promptly even with a "pub trolley" stopping in at the same time. Food was 8/10. My Moscow Mule was one of the best I've had. Food was an excellent price for the quality (under $17).

Ur15YNdBIX7O4NEkIxpL4g.text: This is my favorite place to eat in uptown Charlotte.  It has a cozy feel, good beer selection, consistently great food, and a very nice staff.

pqUZPXdr5dWQjjvnlAeGxA.text: This uptown Charlotte eatery is full of young urban professions; however, it was quiet, clean, and friendly. The wait staff was professional and the food was unique and flavorful. I ate the Laghertha's Turkey Sandwich. The lingonberry aioli was very tasty, the turkey had a good flavor, and the bread was toasted perfectly. My friend ate the drunken chicken which was moist, flavorful, crispy, and had a good batter. You could sit the sandwiches down without them falling apart, a plus. Big portions and and good beer selection make this a great place to dine. Can't wait to go back.

MxDdHgFcARuGf3ypNDvONw.text: Came here for lunch on a weekday, luckily beat the lunch crowd as anywhere gets pretty crazy uptown. I got the goat cheese lamb burger and my boyfriend is obsessed with their meatballs so he got that. All the food was very good. My burger had a lot of goat cheese on it which made me a very happy camper! I also got a Bloody Mary which was excellent. Our server was not very friendly at first, but his co workers were all very nice and they were very attentive at making sure we were doing ok. Would def come back as it is a convenient location and great food!

zOZJ9JjWTkWL1C8_KHR7MQ.text: Yep, I'm a fan. I've eaten here more than anywhere else in Charlotte. It's convenient to most places in the Uptown area and there's plenty of parking nearby.  It's a seat yourself establishment. It's quite small inside. If you're in a rush, best to go elsewhere. Even at its most crowded, there are never more than two staffer working the front of house here. It's slow to order, slow to receive your order, even slower to get any refills or seconds, and even slower than that to get your check and pay.  But the food, beer selection, and vibe keep it at 4 stars. The menu doesn't have a ton of selections, but it's large enough. The burgers are great. The buffalo chicken dip is a definite fav of mine. Skip the salads.  There's several TVs and all tuned to different channels, which is nice.  The staff, when you can get their attention, are very nice and friendly.  Overall, I'm definitely a fan and enjoyed my experiences here.

g-HPOLJjpdQKlXjMZux_9w.text: Great food. Ordered the loaded tater tot appy and fish tacos. Wine topped it off. Great service. It's a great after work meeting place. Gets crowded and loud by worth the food.

AQ8Jy8rv6xrAPaK0WNldpQ.text: I really love this place when certain employees are working. I sat at the bar for a while and watched the bartender greet and help about four other people before she got to me. She never offered me a drink or anything and took so long to come back for my order that i just left. The bartender with the blonde hair..who never smiles...customer service is so essential. I'll come again when the bartender with the brown hair is working. He is super nice and accommodating.

Exh-mWLM6T2AsmJs4pUT0w.text: Who likes Viking food?! I do! The Swedish meatballs are fantastic, my wife enjoyed the Cuban sandwich (at a Viking restaurant right??) great location next to the French Quarter, right across the street from Romare Bearden park. Great place to hang out before hitting the town or even after a night of imbibing, go there for a nightcap. Friendly staff, the prices are reasonable. Great neighborhood restaurant feel.

v4LnsCo1eCOyl98LhsTgDQ.text: The food was good, especially the pretzel bites but the service was...weird. My friend and I didn't want beer but the server seemed oddly secretive about any other options. When we asked about their "juices" which the menu advertised as home made, the server couldn't name one juice that they had on hand. Then when I went to order, he told me the item I wanted was "the worst on the menu" which really threw me off. I ended up getting the veggie burger and my friend got a salad. The server's switched off at one point and the new server said "we're all the same" but I really think the first server tapped out because he didn't like us. When he was originally taking our drink order, he was clearing a table with his back to us half the time. So it was...weird but I would still go back for those pretzel bites!

Cb9aOGdbjrdy37eAbzH21g.text: Great little eatery!  I had The Purist Margarita and my husband had a Guinness!  Our lunch included great wings and the Homemade Veggie Burger. Both were great!!!!  I forgot to take pics but all the pics on here represent well!  Loved the service by Jody and the atmosphere!  It's right off the park and great people watching location.  Oh and a mimosa to finish off our lunch.  5 all around!

31lhB0HJ1hwIGQofvXHZCg.text: This place is cool, flat out. Little, probably a dozen tables total, great local beers on tap, really good food, great music, and near the convention center hotels and such.

yeo5JmXdOAVLFAucI1SayA.text: I had the fish and chips.  Awesome flavor!   Service was great.  I love the style of this pub.  It reminds me of old Pubs in the Old Port section of Portland, ME.

1hNeG38MnL99gFToyJjm5A.text: This is our favorite place in Charlotte.  We get to uptown a couple times a year, and this is usually our first stop after checking into the hotel.  The location is an easy walk from pretty much anywhere in uptown.  The restaurant is casual and bigger than it looks from outside.  The staff is super friendly. They know the menu (food & beer) and are happy to answer questions & help you decide when you can't.  The beer menu changes, not sure how often, but is different and always has new options and seasonal beers every time we get there.  If you are not sure about something on the beer menu ask, they will give you a small taste before you commit.  The food is fantastic.  I always get the lamb burger.   It is delicious!  My husband has had numerous things off the menu and whatever he gets it is always good.  Everything is well prepared and good portions.  The only down side is they don't have desserts.  And you don't leave feeling ripped off, it is good portions for a fair price.  Can't wait for my next trip to Charlotte to get back there again.

QNLjlV_3fWkTFdwGRD4HLA.text: I like the location of this place. I feel like I am back in Lincoln Park in Chicago. Lunch is hectic but to me worth waiting to be seated. I even had dinner for takeout here. Great place to hangout with friends after work. Food is decent and tastes fresh.

u2QtiTqagWaHXDuE59RU2w.text: This edition of Excited about Eating takes us to Valhalla Pub & Eatery located on historical Brevard Court in Uptown Charlotte. Just a few blocks from Bank of America stadium and Time Warner Cable Arena, this cobblestone courtyard boasts pubs, restaurants, and retail stores in an open-air atmosphere.  Dora here. The eclectic menu, including a few Scandinavian dishes like meatballs, lured us to this intimate corner pub. That, and it was just a few blocks to walk from the Charlotte Convention Center, where we were around lunchtime. Once we got here, choosing a single menu item was tough. And check out this view from inside! :)  The Odin's Pretzel Bites were topped with melted cheese and garlic, and served with ranch dipping sauce. A variation from typical pretzels, these bites were great and reminded me of garlic knots that you would get at a pizza joint.   Dora here. Not me. I took the first bite, and...hmmm. But they grew on me. I would've preferred a jazzy mustard dipping sauce over the ranch. To me, the ranch really didn't add flavor, so I stopped dipping.  I chose the Freya's Fish 'n Chips, Guinness-battered haddock fillets served with my favorite, Tater Tots. The fish was crispy on the outside, light and tender on the inside, and full of flavor. The meal included two large fillets that I could not finish by myself.   Dora here. Some of the best fish I've ever tasted! And yes, I was more than happy to help Ernie finish. :)  I'm a sucker for sandwiches with fruit, any entree actually, especially Granny Smith apples. Add cheddar cheese, bacon, lingonberry aioli, and a heaping portion of turkey, and I was all over The Laghertha's Turkey Sandwich. Huge, so Ernie had to help me with mine. Fair's fair, right?   About the only downer for me was the lack of Sweet n Low. So, if you crave a particular brand of sweetener for your tea, bring your own. :) ~Ernie & Dora Hiers, Fiction Faith & Foodies Blog

d0A0vsYhYUj_ITBrW_P9AA.text: Fish tacos and local beers were my pleasure to consume at this corner of Brevard Court. Who doesn't like a dead end street with some eating and drinking options? :-) We had a great server who kept our meal moving along after a long meeting week.

ENe3r4NlH_dXSeYo44SLPw.text: How can you pass up a place named Valhalla!! My son and I just couldn't!! He had the Cuban sandwich and i had the grilled cheese with bacon.  It was delish pub food.  Good food good atmosphere!  Will go again.

Ni67fcKuV9AfK5z9BumCaQ.text: Wow! Another first! Looked this place up and BAM! Glad I did. Came in and the folks here were awesome! Bartender was helpful and the waitress was great with suggestions!  Bartender let me try a few different beers till I was happy! And ya, I was happy. Dawn was a sweetheart, helped a lot. Even was great as well. (Just found out their names). I would highly recommend this place if your in town. I was happy to have stopped and have a few.

4Nb2HKtpeHLwnXWdfvRWlg.text: This review is for drinks and an app in the bar area.  We stopped in before a Saturday matinee at the Knight Theatre (convenient location for doing so!)  We were brought in by Yelp reviews. TIP: There was a check-in special for 10% off food.  They were very very busy.  We found one empty high-top in the bar near the door (burrrrr every time it opened!) where we waited for quite a while before catching anyone's attention.  Understandable though, as the Bartender Gal couldn't possibly have been hustling any faster.  Loved the Bread & Butter Chardonnay I had, and Husband enjoyed a Brew.  We opted to share the Blackened Shrimp.  This enntailed six shrimp that while cooked to a perfect texture, were not in any way blackened.  There were blackening-type spices sprinkled on top AFTER cooking.  Had they been put on and blackened during the cooking process, it would have been indeed blackened shrimp.  That being said they still tasted good.    This place is apparently very popular.  They could sure use more staff as service required much patience, yet was not due to lack of trying on the part of who was working.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Blackened&#34; Shrimp

yl96pVPn9f09Ebx6Cy6w_w.text: So showed up here after a show at 9:45pm and was told that they were no longer serving food even though they are open until midnight.  Needless to say, I was not a happy camper.  They do have a good selection of beer, but not pleased with how we were greeted as soon as we sat down with "we're no longer serving food".  To me, if they are open that late serving beer, they should also offer food.

ycSfoDbzMvrRpaZ7-0uEMQ.text: Valhalla...you had me at Tater Tots.  I went here on a Saturday night to meet some friends.  They swore by this place.  "The food is so good!"  "It's such a hole in the wall, yet it's such a gem!"  They were totally right.  Here's what to expect.  When you walk in, it looks pretty divey.  It's dark, but thanks to the number of TVs and dim lights, you can read the menu.  The place is small, but not super crowded or loud (I guess if there is big game on, it could get packed pretty quickly).  I sat at the table near the window for some excellent people watching.  Perfect if you're meeting some friends for a drink and a casual night out.  The servers are really nice.  I'm still learning all about North Carolina beers, so I asked for a recommendation based on the beers I usually drink.  Her choice was spot on.  The food was really good.  I had the Viking burger with a side of tater tots.  The burger was cooked perfectly and the seasoning was FAN-TAS-TIC.  Seriously, one of the most well seasoned burgers I've ever had.  And of course, you can never go wrong with a side of TATER TOTS!!!  Negatives...don't go to this place if you're in any sort of a rush.  I'm pretty sure our waitress got locked in the beer fridge, because she was gone for most of the meal.  They also don't have dessert.  Boo!  I would come back to this place just for the food.  Forget the Pub part.  The menu looked great and if it's any reflection of my first trip, I will soon be a regular.

9inm7c7bhfNoDDGQclbccA.text: They killed it!!! We walked in the door and were immediately greeted by two servers. Clean, fun, sociable atmosphere. Must try's: Loki's Loaded Tots, Grapefruit Spritzer, and the BlackBerry Apple Cider. For fantastic food and drinks this place is a steal on price. Thank you so much for the great time!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

5RbejQ1SoA3EeKG-HAGSSw.text: Drinks were expensive and terribly mixed and the bartender was hostile and didn't seem keen to serve us because we weren't yuppies in suits. Wouldn't go back if it was the last bar in town, wouldn't recommend it to my worst enemy.

Rfzir9DxqNgBVqtLML4vqQ.text: Came in here for breakfast and left stuffed. It was a very casual atmosphere when we walked in. We were greeted with friendly service and reggae music. We ordered the sunrise omelette which was outstanding. The veggies in that thing were top notch. And I think they put cinnamon or something in their ketchup because that was delicious! We also got a little background on the Valhalla name which was fun. Overall it was a great spot to drop in! If I lived in Charlotte I would be a regular here for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sunrise omelette and Swedish hash breakfast! Such large portions.

mG_p7BBIEIOdhQzxp8jPHA.text: BEWARE; HORRIBLE SERVICE!  My family and I went to this restaurant today based on the fact that they have good reviews on Yelp!, and the close proximity to our hotel.   When we walked in, the only person working was someone at the bar. We sat ourselves. When I was ordering a drink for my daughter, I asked for apple juice; " We don't have apple juice." I said, "Ok, how about orange juice?" She stated, " We only have fresh squeezed, and fresh squeezed lemonade , but it's $4." Thanks for telling me the price, I don't really care, just get us the juice.   She didn't even crack a smile the entire time, and it appeared that we were a bother to her.   My 3 year old daughter started playing with the salt on the table. It came out fast from the dispenser, and made a pile on a small piece of paper with drink specials on it. When the Bartender  (Never got her name, but she has many visual body tattoos and sandy brown hair) came to the table, I asked her if I could please get a plate to put the salt on, so my daughter could play with what remained. She stated, "A plate? I'm definitely not going to do that, sorry. We need the salt. We also need these things." She proceeded to take the paper with the salt away from my daughter who began to cry. We should have left after that.  Who is rude to a 3 year old?   2 STARS: The food was delicious, props to the kitchen. I ordered the Cajun shrimp (not too spicy, delicious sauce and garlic mashed potatoes). My parents ordered the Ahi Tuna Salad, and the Lamb Burger with side salad. My husband ordered the Cajun Shrimp Wrap with green beans. Everyone was satisfied overall with the food. Presentation of the food was nice as well. I've attached pictures.   MINUS 3 STARS: Due to the horrible attitude and service of the Bartender. Also, it appeared the most of the other staff was outside opening new patio furniture. Maybe someone else should be helping Crabby Pants McGee wait tables.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ahi Tuna Salad with Wasabi Dressing.
Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb Burger with side salad.
Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cajun Shrimp Wrap with bacon , and green beans on the side. So delicious he already ate the other half before the picture was taken.

Gu1QT05iGQZqXtawLZw_Aw.text: Four of us stopped in for lunch on a whim and boy was it a lovely surprise. Wait staff was friendly and attentive and food was awesome. We had the wings, fish n chips, cajun shrimp wrap and cajun shrimp entree and it was all tasty hot and fresh. They also have some interesting local drafts that the waitress so kindly let us sample until we found our individual likes. Great meal and fairly priced if i ever make it back to Charlotte again i will return.

_oM4P1MzjzrQEGPDcbcyQA.text: The atmosphere is fun and energetic. Service was friendly and quick. Food was great. The fish and chips was phenomenal! I also enjoyed the list of local beers.

MkAYm6ixvlu8dwA1kwbDfA.text: Tucked in on the corner. Salmon is excellent. Small place downtown but very cool vibe. Good beer choices!

9W9yOWe6-srSNSz-NHnCLg.text: Excellent food and awesome service. I recommend brunch with some drinks! They have both indoor and outdoor seating. Don't forget to tell them bacon AND shrimp in the Bloody Mary.

fXQ5a5IV-XlCPaaOEjTPIQ.text: Food was mediocre at best. The blueberry wings that I was told "I would really regret not getting, the are awesome" we're OK, but nothing special. Service was horrible. I guess her six tables kept her hopping.   The buffalo chip dip was decent.    Then I order another beer and they bring me a 10 plastic glass instead of the pint glass and say that it is the same thing, and that because the game was starting soon, they move to plastic.   Never again. $44 plus a small barely earned tip was not even worth it at half the price.

oW8qAmOj3ABb_H2dkUGn7Q.text: Had dinner and beer here last night with a group of 6 colleagues. I think this is a solid, dependable choice for some good bar food and a good beer. Really not much else to say - I had the Valhalla Burger and it was really good. I was a bit disappointed they were out of the Lamb Burger, but I know I will return and try again.   Check it out!

cJk3G16EvElOiz6O3k1SbQ.text: What can I say. The place is great. Service is excellent, food is great, and location and atmosphere are nice as well.   At first glance the menu seems like they just added Norwegian/Viking names to the beginning of traditional American dishes but upon closer inspection you realize that's not the case.   I got a turkey sandwich and well I was thinking I'll be getting a regular sliced turkey sandwich with some mayo a little bacon and some cheese. I was way wrong. First off it was real turkey like at thanksgiving. Next the bacon was super thick cut and excellent. Let's not forget about the bread. Not sure how to describe it other than fresh and appeared to be house made. Mashed potatoes at Valhalla = awesome - that's all I can say.  I also went there for a happy hour and it was great as well. Excellent service and felt like we were just hanging out at a friend's house well until they brought the bill that is. Ha  So give it a try I think you'll really like it. If you don't well then you may not be ready to be in Valhalla.

lr4WwVIX6nVrSezDxe7_nQ.text: Delicious food and fun environment. We live close by so it is good to know that there is some great quality food so near. The server was very kind and friendly. I will definitely be going back. They are also open later than a lot of restaurants near by so that is an extra plus.  We got the black bean burger, which was unusual for us to order, but it was delicious!   Thanks Valhalla!

BNa2rs2dJt7s2LY099kF7Q.text: The food and atmosphere are wonderful. I love the breakfast for "most of the day". We've had just about everything on the menu and have never been disappointed. The location is prefect for all games and match days.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Warriors omelette

9M4r3Ika9D9UHDQeOVxtaQ.text: We ended up with a layover in this city on our way back from Spain. Tired and hungry for comfort food, we went through the Yelp reviews and found this place.  Smaller selection of beers than we thought, but solid selection. However, no stout or porter.  Hazelnut brown ale was the favorite choice.   The pulled pork tacos were really yummy. Tender and sweet.  Although the hamburger had great flavor, didn't like the presentation on such a large bun.

qBOIH5aoh1bsHYF6vDmnxg.text: I recently visited Valhalla for the first time before a Knights game uptown. Being from Minnesota, I was excited to see a Viking themed pub in the area and I really wanted to check it out. For those not wanting a long read, I'll sum my review up first, then go into detail. The food tasted great (I had a Norwegian Burger), the pub itself is fairly small with about 5 booths and maybe 7-10 tables plus bar seating, and it was VERY NOISY (I was nearly shouting just to talk across the table). All that said, I would definitely go again just based on the quality of the food and the fact that the draft beer menu is nearly all local beers.  So here's more in depth:  Food: As I said, I ordered the Norwegian Burger. I figure that if I'm going to try a new restaurant, I should order something particular to that place. And I was not disappointed. It was delicious. It consisted of a mixed pork and sausage burger on what seemed to be a sub roll, with cheese and an over-easy egg, along with dressing of some sort (I forget what exactly now). I also opted for the bacon on it as an advertised extra for $1.50. The bacon was good, but it was exactly 1 strip of bacon for $1.50. Waaayyyyyy overpriced. Aside from the added unnecessary cost of the bacon though, it was a well priced burger, and I would definitely order it again, sans bacon. It also came with tater tots, and they were perfect, nice and crispy.  Drinks: Their draft beer menu is mostly local beers, which is great. And they also have fresh squeezed juice cocktails, which we didn't get but looked good. I may actually go back to try their spiked lingenberry lemonade.  Decor: Valhalla is a small pub with random viking themed art on the walls. I personally liked the decor, pretty simple but effective.  Noise: Here's where I felt the biggest issue was with Valhalla. The noise level was pretty ridiculous, and not for what seemed to be any good reason. There wasn't a band playing, and the music piped through the speakers wasn't exceptionally loud either. I'm fairly certain it all comes down to acoustics. The magnification of all of the small talk from everyone in the pub mad it necessary to shout just to talk to my wife across the table. And I'm not some old man that can't hear, it was just crazy loud. I wondered if there was anything they could install in the ceilings to try and absorb just some of that sound. It was pretty busy in there while we were there (it was a Saturday before a Knights game), so I wasn't expecting quiet at all. I really do think it just comes down to the acoustics of the pub itself.  Again, to sum it up: Great food, great beer, just make sure to bring your earplugs ;-)

a1B-PWcCoyYCje3WNoFcrg.text: So my mamma was in town and I thought a short walk over to Valhalla would be nice to have a few drinks.  A nice Sonoma wife and a Duck Rabbit Amber made it a good night.

B1Nf-tTgX8jto0kGGakdrQ.text: I came here for a quick brunch before the Internationl Auto Show on a recent Sunday. I enjoy that area alot (Brevard Court) and always thought it's an under-appreciated affordable area in the otherwise expensive and pretentcious Uptown.  The place had a few patrons that late morning, but with only one waitress who also worked as the bartender, service was a little slow. But the most disappointing part was the food/menu in relation to the price. For over $10 I got fried eggs and a so-called hash which was nothing more than fried cut up potato with microscopically diced sausage/bacon/onion. The entire dish lacked flavor. And THAT was their signature dish for brunch (as I asked the waitress for input). I think I'll just come back to this area for a relaxing night out instead. Food is not the forte. There are too many good brunch spots in and around Uptown for that price range.

DcIDfMMPXPdDDyAFK5XoSg.text: I loved this place so much I came back the next day. Great food and cool atmosphere. I got the Lagertha Turkey Sandwich. Amazing. Turkey with melted cheddar cheese, mayo, green apple slices and lingonberry sauce. For my side I got the mashed potatoes which were also very good. I'll def be back for lunch next time I'm in Charlotte! I left very impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey sandwich :)

DLovz8HJ_nXZShUBS3hpKw.text: Meh.   The Buffalo (a place in America) wings were very good but had absolutely no heat.  The Viking (a guy from Norway) hamburger had absolutely no flavor--NONE!.  If this is what food is like in Norway, I understand why so many Norwegians moved here.  Furthermore it explains why Vikings were pissed off all the time.  Did I give it too many stars for a meh?

1_nDFcbUsL0TroBN1GHi1A.text: This is more of a 3.5 star review.  Stopped by here early afternoon on July Fourth as we were walking around downtown. While it was a holiday, they were not extremely busy during our visit. Loved the decor and the food was great ... we both got fish and chips.  What brings my review down is that the service we got was not that great. I felt like we had a black sheet over our table and were forgotten about. Every one around us seemed to be getting good service but it was a struggle for us. When someone did come by it was really rushed and the server was practically walking away while we were still talking.

3cRAdDM-UNqRjLLRjlIw1w.text: The Norwegian meatballs are pretty great as are the crabcakes. It's a shame that on their happy hour slider plate one of your three sliders has to be their lackluster turkey meatball. Still the other two are quite tasty and the staff is friendly and accommodating.   I know it feels sort of too clean and corporate for some but the food, drink and service is so much better than the French Quarter across the alley that I'm not sure why you'd still go there. I guess it being divey-er is cool and all but if your food, booze, and service aren't as good is it still worth it?

am4IkpDn91CIHcvqyvgxAw.text: A great place near The Park with nice staff and Very Good food.  The service was very good and the People's Pot Roast" was excellent.  I would recommend this spot.

0mzWPAJAYchSveWvSdZ24A.text: Great food! Great service! Great atmosphere! Highly recommend the fish and chips... and I am very picky when it comes to seafood. So happy we found this place while here from out of town.

m8EUdgRsZF4weU6JhQyG4Q.text: Valhalla is fresh food, made with care from scratch daily!  If you are nice and respectful, we will bend over backwards to make you happy.  We truly care about great service, great food and an awesome beer selection!  We hope you enjoy your visit, but if you don't, for whatever reason...please tell us while you are here!  If we can make it right, we will.   There are people, we know, who just cannot be pleased.  Haha.  We are sorry if you are one of those and wish you well on your way.  For all the other fun and cool people of the world...come and check us out!  Sincerely, Jennifer General Manager

GSV1rga_z8pGP4ZOc7pO4w.text: Killer burger (I had the Norwegian) & stupendous service,  even though they were slammed with football game goers!  My girl had the triple grilled cheese, also fantastic!   Cool decor,  casual & fun atmosphere,  we will absolutely eat here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Norwegian burger #Valhalla Charlotte

E5EsHlyjhJC2nSRjqiRidw.text: In the last two days I've eaten three meals at Valhalla.  It's True.  I would not lie about something that puts me at a slight risk for appearing to be that creepy guy that hangs out at the bar all weekend.  No, I HAD to eat three meals there so I could write a proper review of the restaurant.  I did it all for the cause.    Prior to eating here the only Scandinavian food I'd ever eaten was at Ikea. There was also that cereal in the 80s with the Swedish Chef on the box (please tell me that you guys remember Croonchy Stars), so I guess I can count my Scandinavian experience on 2 fingers.  While the menu leans heavily toward Scandinavian food, the diversity of the owners'  backgrounds are reflected in items such as the English breakfast and an amazing curry sauce.  Let me pause for a moment to tell you that I could drink both the curry sauce and the brown gravy from a mug.  Or a horn.  Both are staples on the menu and both are family recipes that the owners were kind enough to share with the rest of us.  Try the Warrior fries with the curry.  Amazing.  And if you're wondering what a Warrior fry is, it is a waffle fry like they serve at Chick Fil-A but more badass because it is a warrior and the others are not.    Breakfast:  Northern Eggs Benedict.  Two poached eggs on toast with a good portion of smoked salmon, capers, red onion and fried potatoes.  No hollandaise sauce here, so I'll live to see another day.  A beurre blanc replaces hollandaise on the Valhalla menu and I found it perfect and not overpowering.    Lunch:  The Mighty Meatball.  Pork and beef meatballs with brown gravy and choice of a side.  I, of course, chose the Warrior fries.  Eat your heart out, Ikea.  AND you can eat these meatballs without the fear of having to go rug shopping with your wife afterward.    Dinner:  The Banger Butty.  The name alone made me go for this one.  I really like alliteration.  This sandwich is bangers (sausages) with the curry sauce on a roll that must be of Scandinavian origin because it was pale, beautiful and tasty.    Valhalla is not to be missed!  Chances are you'll find me there sooner than later and you can thank me then for my dedication this weekend so that I could bring you this top-flight review.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

F2jlx6ZzvLGTbnFidSdPJw.text: I really like this place. I've only been a few times, but each time it's been good food, good drinks and good times. I love the location and feel of the place, especially if you can get a little table outside.  I've had the wings and shrimp wrap here, both of which I really enjoyed. Shrimp wrap came with tater tots which were on point and the wrap itself was tasty with good size shrimp inside. I always order wings either naked or dry rub so I can't speak to the sauces here, but the wings are tasty and a good size. They always have a good beer selection and the prices are fair.  Just recently tried the "Homemade" Bloody Mary which has a really good taste, it just has A LOT of "stuff" in it. By stuff I don't mean the extras like olives, lemon, lime, celery, etc. I mean the seasoning, seeds, pepper bits, etc. I'm not totally sure what it all was, but my straw kept getting clogged and if I drank from the bottom it was overwhelming. You almost have to leave the last few sips in the glass unless you want to chew your bloody mary. Again, it had a great flavor, but not my favorite of "mixes".  Overall, this place is a great little hangout with a few friends to grab some bar food and enjoy conversation. We'll definitely be back!

H9J6RDG_wGgbxkIhy1dHbQ.text: It's a great place to get a beer after work and the food's not bad..the Viking Burger is where it's at.

E6jYeChDWP0QjOeWwWcmBA.text: I've tried ordering takeout here twice in the last month around 8-8:30pm and either they don't answer after multiple tries (tonight) or the kitchen is closed. Maybe there should be separate hours for food and the bar if their kitchen is going to close so early every night? Would really like to try their food sometime but might give up after this.

NYwgr43r-Kr_D6-6HZ6oVw.text: Actually did a two-fer here last Saturday. Valhalla is the official location the the Liverpool Football Club watch parties so I came in around 12:30p to watch the Liverpool match with a friend. Place was PACKED!! We ended up getting a table in the smaller back room to watch. I did not order any food, but they have a great selection of beers including some session offerings from local breweries.  Came BACK to Valhalla that evening, because I have a drinking problem. Actually I was with a group of friends and we had eaten dinner at Ink 'n' Ivy, so we walked over to Valhalla for a nightcap. Decidedly less busy, but still well populated. Had a couple drinks and then everyone bailed out.  I like this place because it is close walking distance to almost anything you want to do in uptown, and they have a really cool vibe (pumping out some 90s pop music on Saturday night). Unfortunately I've not been to Valhalla with food in mind, but will definitely return with that end.

rRyPgfy1gMK_FZ6adU7cPg.text: Good place to watch football on a weekend. I like how they have local beers and serve organic chicken. Ordered the buffalo chicken bites and Swedish meatballs. The place felt clean and the staff was attentive.

UUKF8Wu0nr64ZmyMxjQF-Q.text: We came here before a concert at the Knight Theater based on Yelp reviews and we were not disappointed. We ate at the bar because it was a little warm to sit outside. My hubby had the Viking sandwich and I had the Black and Blue Salad. Both were excellent. I'm not a beer fan so I ordered a cocktail and it was a good pour. Hubby enjoyed the Hop Drop 'N Roll IPA. I'm glad we came here and I'll definitely be back.

2K8Ci_vj51ggNAYfDHvdTg.text: Very good pretzel bite appetizer and buffalo chicken dip! Sometimes a bit of a wait to get a table but it's worth it. They have a good beer and wine selection as well

l6uDWL45km6Ki1mQ_ofvKQ.text: If I'm heading to a Knights or Panthers game, you can find me over in Latta Arcade. The entire alley is such a great pre and post game spot.  Rule number one for a sporting event: eat a meal before you start boozing. It sounds simple, right? Of course, it never is. We ventured here around 4pm before the Monday Night Football game. We ordered chips and salsa, the triple grilled cheese with waffle fries, hot dogs with kraut (plus mashed potatoes and gravy), and a couple of quesadillas. Now, I have no idea if they make the gravy from scratch, but I will say it's peppery and absolutely delicious. I will make sure every order I place here included something covered in gravy. The grilled cheese features brie as one of the three. Let's face it, brie makes everything better. A warning about the quesadilla: the Habenero Ranch is no joke. It's a delayed burn after the first taste. The table next to us got the fish and chips and I immediately wanted to order that, too. Huge portion for the fish. It looked really good.  This place was absolutely slammed both inside and on the patio, but the staff never seemed to miss a beat. We had fantastic service and several people waiting on us. Thanks Valhalla for being a consistent game day favorite. Oh, and GO PANTHERS!!! Rarrrrrrrrrrrr.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Triple grilled cheese. Brie makes everything better!
Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sauerkraut dogs on pretzel rolls with mashed potatoes and gravy

aku9CGIapA940n_v5mKk8A.text: Valhalla is located in the French quarter area in uptown Charlotte. The area is a little stowaway that is completely contrast to the skyscraper/apartments surrounding it. Valhalla is the first restaurant/bar located at the entrance to the quarter. Food is great we had the wings and possibly one of the best poeboys I've ever had! My only compliant is that for a restaurant named Valhalla and decorated with Viking weaponry they don't offer pitchers which doesn't match the Viking theme!

WVur5yH8I09GpGO6aPxFEw.text: Great ambience and service they use a team concept and you constantly enjoyed the awesome service weather they were refilling your drink or asking you if you need anything the value was OK but the service was spectacular

L9C0a8QFEeDTnshLsog1sA.text: This place is situated across the street from Beaden park. The restaurant fronts the park with some tables on the side in the alley with a few other gathering places. The inside is pub-like with seating at the bar, some booths and tables on one side, and some barstool/high tables on the other side. Some Viking decor to round it out. Four TVs around for watching events etc. The staff was friendly and efficient.   I had the Norwegian meatballs with brown gravy, waffle fries (everyone was mentioning them in other reviews so I had to try), and toast. It comes with steamed broccoli which I didn't get as I don't eat it. The meatballs looked like little hamburgers but were flavorful and the gravy was delicious. I had a Moscow mule to drink. Complete with the copper mug and fresh squeezed lime juice in it. Mmm. I watched while the bartender was making drinks for people and he squeezed fresh juice each time for the cocktails calling for it. Impressive.   Come give this place a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ladies room door. Liked the artwork.
Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mens room door. Liked the artwork.
Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Norwegian meatballs with toast and waffle fries. Good!

J6fbswZS0lKDcnDKeq-bJg.text: Bite size pretzels were the best! Full of cheesy garlic flavor. Fish & Chips were better than what I've had in London. The lamb burger was definitely full of flavor! I'd recommend this place to anyone, local or tourist.

zwwNazG4l0LKJHqu62hRpQ.text: Absolutely LOVE this place. It's the home pub for the Official Liverpool FC Supporters Club so they open up early if their matches are on. The staff is warm & friendly with just that right amount of attitude that makes it fun. & the food? AWESOME!! The lamb burger & turkey wrap are lunch favorites & perfect with their local beers on tap. The English Breakfast is great & the Warrior Omelette is perfect if you're doing keto/low glycemic. & if you are having breakfast/brunch, have a Bloody Mary, or Mimosa - trust me.

vToorwe2DF7cPfA-ZKff2Q.text: My favorite place in Charlotte. The location is awesome and the ambiance is so cool. Their happy hour food is the way to go: cheese fries and quesadilla. Be prepared that both are very spicy but extremely delicious.

tZ1MPqRwyg1_QNWrNcvI6A.text: Stopped by with friends for happy hour. Had rum with fruit juices. It was weak, so I ordered the second with a double of rum. Charged $9 ($7 rum, $2 juice) for the first drink and $16 ($7 rum $7 rum $2 juice) for the second. Equally as unimpressive and a rip off. I also didn't know this was how I was being charged until I got my bill. Second was the buffalo chicken dip. $10 is not a bad price, but the size was silly. It was the size of a coffee cup and wasn't at all hot. I asked them to heat it up, which they did without issue. However, what I make at home is better. Overall unimpressed. Then towards the end of our visit, a guy who had not been out waiter brought us the checks. It was odd because he wasn't particularly friendly and he came out of nowhere. Our waitress was fine. Not sure that I'll be back here. Other Yelper food pics look great, but my experience was very lack luster.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffalo chicken dip. Tiny for $10.

bJ6U22P6vfuwMghV-7PNfA.text: Always good lunch here. Having the drunken fish tacos today. The guys had fish n chips too. All was on point and this is on our regular rotation.

_Op0YS6xDA6ooASQ478BjQ.text: Never recommend this disgusting place, the staff was rude and not brought up, they did not respect me and my wife. Prices do not match the quality of service. The server or waiter was in a state of stress or something happened with him, he was very angry. I did not understand what was happening. I live across the street and often visit this area , I recommend a Greek restaurant and a beer house Hooligans, in these places excellent service and professional staff.  Never visit this place  Vintage Lounge at Valhalla !!!!!!!!!!! p.s if you take a look at pic this place is not busy..... despite the fact that this is an evening of Friday.

zsWxRkKA_WyDjGSWs8DhpA.text: This would qualify as a dive bar in my mind, but the friendliness of the staff and the food keep me coming back.  The have some interesting options with the norse/Scandinavian theme.  I like the Sunna's smoked salmon.  The sandwiches are good as well.  I think they do make an effort to offer some different bar fare, which I appreciate.  It can get very packed in here if there are events going on or right after work.

r4szry9vk6gTO56tNhHGDA.text: Pub food at its best. Great food and drinks with a simple menu and great beer menu. Service is on point and the variety of beer, which ours was served in a Pilsner glass.   The food menu features a Bourbon battered haddock which you can get in a sandwich or taco style. The batter is flavorful, crispy and delicious.   Nice place to eat and drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bourbon battered tacos with Cole slaw.
Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

yTROtRlj5SwkG4muwh6SdA.text: Delicious food place for a pub! The combination of flavors is nicely paired. The beer selection is excellent & the staff is polite without intrusive. Highly recommend

8rCRPHwMe_KfNGhdDIvGGg.text: Came here for lunch with coworkers one day. It was the perfect little pub for us to dine at! 3 of us got their Cuban sandwich, others their steak tacos, and one got their triple grilled cheese.   All great food. The Cuban sandwich was RLY GOOD. I'm Cuban and have Cubanos down in Miami a lot, and these are comparable.   The venue had a great ambiance and the service was top notch. Come check out Valhalla the next time you're by the French Quarter!

wd0wi5W2JeKdY8oz_MmIUw.text: Went here strictly because of the name and was not disappointed. We got Lagertha's Turkey Sandwich and Lothbrok Lamb Burger. Both were pretty heavy on the cheese, but we left full and happy. The Turkey Sandwich was delicious and a very good size for the price. The beer selection was good, and I was pleased to see a cider that wasn't Angry Orchard AND locally made.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is the Lagertha Turkey Sandwich with lingonberry jam, apples and cheddar cheese. A very good size sandwich for the price.

1pLc8QTkMPXUaXf4klzBgQ.text: Went here for some appetizers and drinks before the Panthers game. Looked like a neat little place, but left feeling like I didn't get enough for my money. They do have a nice selection of local beers. We ordered three appetizers: Pretzel Bites, Wings and Buffalo Chicken Dip. The Pretzel Bites, you only get 12 one biters and have some cheese melted on top, for sure not worth $7. The wings are reasonably priced, but overcooked. The buffalo dip was good, but again for $10 you are not getting enough. With the amount of options in the area, I will not be back.

f3DE9A9Lv1T4p6M_LhUYLA.text: I tried the Northern Eggs Benedict (smoked salmon), which was quite good...I would order it again. Breakfast is served most of the day (NOT between 12 & 2p). The service was quick & fairly friendly. The interior has an old fashioned pub feel. I'll definitely go back for either this dish or to try something new.

M-IB5PI5SQQC8ZJzyfO9Pg.text: Local brews on tap. Pub fare and a heinous  viking atmosphere. Close enough to pre party before the Panthers NFL game

ALJ1Rao51fSQNfIa2GjmCA.text: Excellent food. Very surprising from looking at the small pub, but the atmosphere and food are both awesome.

1C9E2IHZ5rzOqphNC1QQ3w.text: I feel bad for the poor bartender who had to serve everyone and cook the food! The chef couldn't make it to work... Where was the manager to deal with the customers who were forced to wait over an hour for food???? In the back, letter her continue to seat people as one table after another sat forever and then left...  Pathetic!!!!

BtO4sgnBQ_oJPmFovEfI_A.text: I must admit the theme of this place is what sold me. While the music is no where near metal or Norwegian folk, classic rock never disappoints.  Plus there's a small but quality selection rotating craft beers on tap. Have to give a shout out to Bob. Awesome server; very helpful and attentive. If he is the same way when the place is crowded then he truly has talent. Get the Norwegian burger, delicious and filling! Nice place!

pJ68OMuiizi-RE7loIQ_qw.text: After reading the reviews of the norwegian burger, I decided i must try this place out!  So for my birthday my friends asked me where I wanted to go and it was here.  All of us but one got the norwegian burger.  It was freaking amazing.  It come one a sub type roll with egg and deliciousness all packed inside.  The pork/meat blend was perfect and the waitress said she would try for us to have the burger cooked on the edge :). This was the second best burger I have ever had in Charlotte. There were a good selection of beer on tap.  The only downside was it took about 30 minutes for our food to come out once we ordered. I will be back just for the norwegian burger.

Ebd8wIeFN04A-IFjgt7YoQ.text: Great food. Terrible service. If you're expecting speed or personality, this is not your spot. I'm in the industry, so I'm pretty lenient if a place is slammed or understaffed, unfortunately neither was the case on a Tuesday night around 9:30PM. Next time I want this food, I'll be ordering it ToGo!

JABZYgHrT9unt2wVt4BTvQ.text: Went on a Tuesday evening.  Was one of two people in the place.  Had the Norske burger which was great all around.  I'm norwegian so had to buy a t-shirt.  Not too expensive.  Service was great.  Well the waitress could have hand fed me since it was dead.

cmF8w6mcK60ofiwpdXrVsA.text: I like this place. It's got a great feel to it, the food is reasonably priced, and the meatball sandwich was very good.

4eiAMTSqtxmFDk6PyR6qjw.text: Had a fantastic lunch there.  Enjoyed the braised cod -- a fantastic choice for anyone eating gluten or dairy free.   Friendly staff, generous portions.  Everybody in my work group liked what they had and we all agree we will go back!  They should offer helmets with horns for anyone ordering the Viking Burger. Even enjoyed a couple of rounds of pool while waiting for the food to come out.  Great rock music but a bit loud four lunch.  If it's as loud next time I'll ask to get it turned down some.

GOIsX0Itk67gpp9sAPyqjw.text: This was by far the worst experience I have had while dining in Charlotte. We went to brunch around noon and were seated in a back room. After 10 minutes we still hadn't had a server greet us so we politely told the bartender who responded with "we're really busy"...he proceeded to come in and take our drink order. As we went around the table ordering drinks each of us said "I'll have a ... And a water please" by the 3rd person he interrupted her order and rudely said "I get it everyone's having water too, next". I was in complete shock that he would speak to us like that. It only got worse from there. Our waitress finally showed up and we never really saw her again. The food was okay (burger was awful) but the service was so bad that we will never be back.

aybqyMtY6xUcELs6GDXkCw.text: Went for just a pint and hoping to get a smoke salmon appetizer.  But to my surprise not smoke salmon appetizer to be found.  Service was kinda slow but I was there mid week and early afternoon.  If I had more time in the city I'd give it another try.

DX7f-SP0-bnv9iNrd2GjOg.text: the food is good but the SERVICE is HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!   Get some people in there that has better personalities.  Our LARGE order was wrong and instead of them trying to make it right, I was given attitude.  this is such a disappointment because the food is really good.  so I won't be going back.  and will spread the word though out my office.

EkYaS1jjvKyS6PWHzaPKfQ.text: Excellent staff. I let the bartender surprise me by letting her order my meal.  Absolutely no disappointments with the Swedish meatball platter.  Food was right on target, beer selection is excellent, good whiskey on hand.  Really enjoyed talking with the regulars at the bar - not awkward and made me feel really at home.  Highly recommend this little nook of Charlotte.

TQdRga-XpsNkJIWkpGtQYA.text: I called the restaurant to inquire about the prices and the gentlement who answered was talking to someone else and then he just hung up, I called back and someone just pressed the buttons...really..I work for the media and trust me, I give reviews of new restaurants...this will get a big negative review from me. Next time..tell your phone people to have customer service skills....NEVER EATING HERE!!!

psTDajH9Euc7W5aYy5rxDQ.text: The food was ok if you don't mind waiting over an hour to get served then another 20min to get your check and another 10-15min to get your credit card back after paying. We were seated in the back room and enjoyed spanish television on mute for the 2 hour lunch experience. Best of all, we were a group of 8 and a few of us ordered the same things but somehow some burgers were half the size of others and the order of fries also varied very drastically. I wish I could give them negative stars if that was possible!

8l2XGnJ_M1Gja0rg4RQb-Q.text: If I could give this place 0 stars, I would. Came here last night and was looking forward to it, but was disappointed by the service, food and lack of theme. Walk over to QCBC or French Quarter instead

lt5hUgZKhtv5QiEgNhlwzg.text: I was in the mood to try something new so I came to Valhalla since it's in walking distance from my place. It was just me so I dined solo and was immediately greeted when I sat down at the bar! The bartender was REALLY nice, offered suggestions and was very attentive. I ordered the Swiss omelette and it was delicious! It comes with county potatoes which were cooked to perfection. It's a tiny spot but the customer service is great! There's always a great view of uptown from inside. Will definitely come back!

Wd7jXXEVQX5tQUzPmsBVyA.text: DO NOT GO HERE!!!!!!! Awful service and drinks. Place was not busy at all and it took 30 mins for someone to ask for our drinks. Then another 30 mins to bring our drinks. Very disgusting watered down drinks. Awful!! Then I asked if sauce costs extra and the owner said no, then saw on my receipt that he charged me extra for sauce. I said you said it was free and he said "yeah I know but so what? It's only 50 cents, who cares". He was so rude and refused to take off the extra charge even though he said it was free. I only tipped 10 percent and he ran out of the restaurant screaming "motherf*cker don't ever come back". It was the worst experience I have ever had at a restaurant. Absolutely TERRIBLE PLACE and owner. Do not go here!!!!

LPIpyIpBujdhQZ_aeAjVzA.text: Small, conveniently located bar across from Romare Bearden park on Church Street. Friendly staff. I haven't tried the drinks but they have an extensive beer list. I see a lot of traffic on weekends and during lunch time on week days.   I had the fish and chips which were pretty good. Not the best that I've had but still pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

6W7lk9XWFEDmRTtkadS-1g.text: We went there on Sunday to have drinks and to grab a bite. The place is perfect for that, it has a great view and vibe. I highly recommend

6JzvM-KNgf_AKNN1-0UxBQ.text: Small pub with great pub food. My favorite appetizer was the poke tuna. The pretzels bites was my second favorite. I also ordered shrimp entree and it was actually really good. Our server was also great in taking care of our group.

24PbavL03HQGyRC4TRm4lA.text: This is our go to neighborhood bar and restaurant. Whenever I don't know where my husband is I am pretty certain that he is at Valhalla  It is super cozy inside and the service is always on point. You will never find yourself waiting for a drink. All of the food is made from scratch and so tasty. It is a little difficult to eat healthy here but the calories are worth it. I am a huge fan of the turkey sandwich that comes on toast with cheddar and bacon and green apple slices...YUM. Also, the chicken bites to start (try them tossed in the blueberry chipotle sauce), Buffalo chicken dip and hummus are all awesome. My husband loves the Chipotle turkey wrap. They also serve tater tots...need I say more?! They own the wine bar that is connected and it's also a very cozy, intimate spot to grab a bottle of wine. The breakfast menu is also awesome and they serve a mean mimosa with fresh squeezed OJ! Definitely check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Drunken chicken sandy
Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey sandwich
Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chipotle turkey wrap with waffle fries

V9q4ViwH5f1KYtf464MR3A.text: Huge disappointment . It has a really cool atmosphere. Small and friendly feel but service sucked. Attentive at first. It seems to be a very local oriented place so the service assumed we knew what we wanted to drink as soon as we sat down. We needed to look at the choices. So it took a while to get our order. We were not ready to order food but told service we just needed to figure out the menu. Service never came back. The server switched to being the bartender so I went up and told her were ready to order. I was nice about it. She didn't react well. We waited for another ten minutes and no service so we left money on the table and left. I have never written a negative review for anything ever until now. Pissed.

8YYxS4Dh5xdxdy032c3joA.text: This is a cool place. I love the atmosphere and the view is heat across from the park! The food was great. I ordered the special for today which was the Pesto Grill Chicken Sandwich with waffle fries. Yummm! My grill chicken was very tender and their homemade pesto sauce was delicious. The customer service was great but the only this I wasn't a fan of the new thing that a few restaurants are doing is not providing straws for your drinks anymore?! I didn't drink anything while dining here due to not having a straw.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

N49kQ2oTLVkhrMjcPkl_0Q.text: Came for drinks on gay pride parade day.  We were pretty worried that it would be crowded.  They were worried, too, and had reduced their menu significantly to prepare.  We were both wrong.    It wasn't crowded but I was disappointed at how little they were offering food-wise.  I did try the fish and chips which everyone had recommended.  Honestly, I was not impressed.  The fried batter was great, truly, but it was fried batter.  The fish, on the other hand, was dry.  Not like flaky and delicate.  Like bad.  If this is their best dish, I'd strongly suggest skipping the food altogether.    The drinks were solid.  I tried multiple citrus margaritas--all were impressive.  They have this HUGE citrus press right on the counter of the bar next to a multi-tiered basket stand of citrus fruits.  They seem to do it all.  Lemon, lime, orange, grapefruit, all available fresh and freshly squeezed.  The drinks aren't traditional, but with the fresh squeezed juice are undeniably good.  Come here for this.  My friends also enjoyed the variety of beers.    The service was friendly, but slow, even given that they were prepared for a crowd that hadn't yet shown.  We liked everyone we talked to and the staff were very accommodating, but more than half of our drinks needed reminding and we had to track down waters and water refills, napkins, and a bill correction.  Bathrooms were nice, though.    I'd go back, especially to watch a game, but I wouldn't do food there again.

CQrnMHxYyFgRdHTKzkmLxw.text: We came in to watch the Final 4 game and have some appetizers and drinks. We got the loaded tots and buffalo chicken dip. Both were large enough for the 3 of us to split and delicious! The service was also top notch.

t6-i4avYcPTmYBLNlqdSAA.text: This place is amazing.. the food is like eating at a crafty restaurant. The Philly cheese steak is insane!! So are the fish and chips and the chef salad. Definitely a must go to. They have TVs and great beer selection

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

2GM_f_CQJdBm7KT921ef6w.text: We ate here before we went to see primus and mastodon, AMAZING! If you've seen the show Vikings some of the food is named after the characters. I got the lagertha turkey sandwich it was perfect, had apples, pulled turkey, bacon, cheddar cheese. I got a salad for an extra $1.75 was very good too. Husband got a lamb burger with mashed potatoes also perfect. We got the pretzel appetizer and the loaded tots, both excellent I definitely loved the tots!!!! Have to remember this place! PS: my friend asked for a straw and the waitress replied "we don't carry straws we are trying to save the planet." So byos

KixLr416v0Oaq8rqQrIhrg.text: The drinks were good, once we actually were served! Visited on a thursday afternoon, around 4pm. Totally understand that it's the beginning of the work crew coming out and you get busy, but maybe that's an indication that you need to staff up during this time. We sat at our table for a good 20-25 minutes after the bartender said someone will be right over before someone finally came. We tried to order at the bar but the other bartender wouldn't even make eye contact.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

qqoV16FIvqhAD7IUyMpn3g.text: Service was incredibly fast for drinks. We started with the tuna and it was cooked perfectly rare. The wasabi dressing was the star if the dish with it not being abundantly over powering. A good size for two people.  I ordered the fish and chips and just wow. I was concerned that the fish was burnt but that was probably due to the Guinness batter. Great tarter sauce and the waffle fries were pretty good as well.   My wife ordered the grilled chicken with broccoli , delicious. The broccoli was cooked perfectly and the flavors of the sauce in the chicken were outstanding. "Maybe we will only come here while in charlotte"-wife   Overall just a solid easy meal with nothing that you have to think too hard about. Great flavors, incredibly fast service for drinks and food.   We will definitely make this a stop when we are in town.

eHdFI1oN8PDDaGL24se12w.text: Fun little spot near my apt that we often flock to for convenience and their fresh squeezed grapefruit. The stag could be a little friendlier and more quick to recognize our presence but never has it been horrible enough to not go in.

ZB0iwncdKS0uWOgURiLmxQ.text: I'm not sure how to rate, still. I visited Valhalla during the week and had a fried Haddock sandwich. It was good as was the house made tarter sauce. However, the remainder of the day I didn't feel great - I'm not positive this had anything to do with Valhalla so eventually I will try there again since it's close to my office. Perhaps in this southern July heat I should go for lighter fare.  Flavor was good as was the service.

DMl4AnT5Thtuvp45_B-3qQ.text: Sometimes you just walk into a place not realizing you're going to be thinking about it the next day. This was definitely one of those experiences. We were not planning on coming here but happened by chance to walk by during our exploration of downtown. We walked by those who were dining outside and decided we had to try it ourselves. The fish and chips were amazing. The lamb burger was also fantastic, the mix of spices and toppings were a wonderful balance of a Mediterranean blend with each bite. The bar tenders were also great. Asked for a drink menu and was told everything is made fresh, so they don't really have one. On a hot day asked for a vodka lemonade and got a crisp and refreshing fresh squeezed lemonade spiked just right.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish n chips!

fjyLsok2iOSEUe95z_jIRw.text: Good beer and really good reasonably priced food for an urban area. Norwegian Meatballs kick and the Pot Roast was equally good.  Nice Surprise in uptown Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

XG_ZRpKpUswHVv08Nkb9GQ.text: The food was okay, slightly disappointing.  The place was busy but the service was terrible and unfriendly.  It is a shame that single diners are treated like bothers.  Would have appreciated a straw but since I only saw my server three times (place order, get food, get check), that didn't happen.

5CAFJ5lTJfvLEe-3ilsytA.text: UGH!, I don't even know where to start. But I came for lunch around 11:45a and why, there was a nice welcome... well that was the end of it!.
