We sat down pretty quickly but it wasn't until around 12:10-12:15 when we finally got our drinks and finally placed our orders, in the end after having 3 waiters and having to stand up countless of time to ask about our food (chicken wings, Sandwich and a turkey wrap ), we finally received out food. Which included COLD! fries and under-cooked chicken wings. Needless to say I was completely disappointed with the experience, but I will DEFINITIVELY NOT return to this place.

zPH7uWWBrmhf61ZA-tfdmQ.text: Went before the Panthers game against Arizona. Place was packed, but we got a table right away. First impression... I like it. Great beer selection! First we had the Buffalo chicken dip. It was really good! Would definitely order again.  I ordered the viking burger. I must say, I was impressed when it came. even more so when I bit in. Great texture, lots of flavor, and HUGE! She had the pot roast. It was ok. It was fatty, so half wasn't good. flavor was ok, but probably wouldn't order again. If not for the dip and burger I would be giving 3 stars.  I will be back!

UaTrGUqWoQElvIICmDt3DA.text: Hooligans and Vikings, I can dig it. Valhalla is brought to us by  the owner of Hooligans. And he scores a big goooooooooooooooooooooal here. Clean, modern, and a gastropub  if you will. Although I've yet to partake in the nectar of the Norse  gods, I can surely attest to the hamburgers of the gods.   Viking burger or Norske burger, have at it. I personally prefer the Norske, because it's accompanied with one of my fave things, a fried egg. A massive pork/beef mixture and shaped like a sub sandwich, this burger's a winner folks. At $8, easily one of the best burgers in Charlotte. Not feelin' the hog, opt for the seafarers. Vikings ate fish too ya know.   A great addition to the uptown scene, and I can already see this being one of the hippest spots around.

tNrF4qAH2cKVgSgN_luO0A.text: I discovered Valhalla from friends and have enjoyed brunch there several times over the past month.  I have really enjoyed the experience.  The food is very tasty, the price is very affordable and compared to other places - it is very easy to get a table for brunch.  We had our lunch at the outside tables this past weekend and between the great food and the beautiful weather we found ourselves staying longer than we expected to.  I have recommended this place to others as a great place for Sunday Brunch.  It's uptown location prevents me from visiting at other times but for Sunday brunch the parking is plentiful, the service is excellant and the food is tasty.  Highly recommend.  The only thing about Sunday brunch is they are sometimes out of the more popular selections.  There weren't any bangers this Sunday for example.  There were other wonderful selections though that more than made up for the lack - the Northern Eggs Benedict was yum!!

5tcHxcl_4HuRNTEgy-P-HQ.text: A beautiful place after a long Saturday night. Fish and chips were excellent. Wings were on point. There cheese fries were cold. Service was great.

y5EXSpPEysuF_7zXmuCOLg.text: Valhalla is a great place to grab a drink and some food. I used to live in Copenhagen so I can attest to the quality of food. The beer selection also included some very good Scandinavian beers, which can be hard to find in most cities in America.  The decor was great too. Wood benches, tables, columns, some weapons and viking helmets.   I highly suggest this place to anyone looking for a quality spot in Uptown.

GHsWr2AKHz4vLuXSOSgdZA.text: The food was average but restaurant itself was cool looking. Sadly.. the service was probs the worst I've ever had.. they took our drink orders pretty quick but they took about 15 minutes to come out... then... our waitress LEFT and apparently communication was lost between everyone else so we sat there.. waiting.. for 20 minutes.. so I stopped the closed employee who knew nothing about it. We proceeded to order and our food took a bit as well [mind you it was NOT busy] then the bill came, no compensation for anything. Yes I could have brought that up but ya know what, if a restaurant is only compensate people who throw a fit instead of just doing whats right then that is a place not worth my time or buisness

j3lDSsUeeKipFkHC32lkXA.text: Went for NYE.... crowded (expected) BF had a drink, I used the bathroom (which was nice and clean) then we sat outside (too cold) and left... not an area of town we usually frequent but would like to go back and check out on a less crazy night. Love the small bar feel of the place.

Mv-etebiopxZegSyKHauyg.text: The fish and chips are a regular favorite of mine! And with the fresh squeezed juice, Valhalla has the best margaritas in town!

0JMUPh8kGX7NJJnn4hn0Sg.text: Pretty good! Impressed with service. Breakfast was awesome. A local IPA on tap that's amazing.

F3_KDvQqMt9NJEiiCOBicg.text: Valhalla is a fantastic place in a really fun little corner of Downtown Charlotte.  It's situated in a historic building with an open air courtyard that in the evening, is an awesome place to hang out.     In the first week they were open, I ended up going to Valhalla three or four times.  The food is fresh, reasonably priced and really yummy!  The veggie burger is one of the best I've ever had... a homemade black bean patty with fresh jalapenos and an incredible homemade salsa and curry sauce.  I also really enjoyed their fish sandwich, with a Guinness breading and malt vinegar.  All in all, it's a GREAT restaurant and one I plan to go back to time and time again.  It's the perfect place for a pre-show or post-show meal or drink if you are going to the Knight Theater, too.

kPZMcTf-15k_yl-mD0ainQ.text: My wife and I stopped in after the ACC title game for a pint and really enjoyed it. The bar is a little small and watch your step walking in, there is a step RIGHT in front of the door. The rest of the space is a good size and the bartenders are really friendly.

xs53I6J1VeQ_O4n5-b-Mvg.text: Very solid recommendation as they deserve  four star rating. Everything we wanted in a pub:  good food, nice draught ales and beers, great service, and distinctive vibe. Loved their Scandinavian take on a burger...YUM!!

E1IjOW-SBtj8R3qH7bAAVg.text: In town for work and wanted a good place to eat, drink and feel at home. Valhalla is the place. Delicious food (try the meatballs), reasonably priced drinks, and excellent service. Came in to watch the World Cup semifinals and had more fun than I could've ever expected. Jody, the bartender, is top notch. She makes a mean drink and is great at chatting it up and making you feel right at home. I will definitely be back here every time I'm in Charlotte and hope that others enjoy this jewel in the Queen City as much as I do.

_7Qu_cKq2HoGVUwECSf_aQ.text: I tried here on a Sunday and the place was slow, but the server was pleasant and greeted me nicely. I tried the wings with creole and they were wonderful. Even with the slow business they did a good job. Would recommend. There was one question, the check in on Yelp popped up a discount for doing the check-in, but they were not aware of it. So just curious how that is supposed to work.

uiM1FioV2mjnEJwWgn9uYg.text: Tonight I stopped by there for a great dinner of swedish mratballs, mashed potatoes, broccoli and beer! What great comfort food at an ok price in uptown Charlotte.   Thanks guys!!

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Check out the list of NC beers on tap!!
Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

mQPuYXAIoOAZmsvmlrIhBQ.text: Great "Norwegian" burger, good vibes, friendly service, good beer menu.

iTkr9nzNd3f8OkKwz8cc0Q.text: I ate here my first night in town. It was good. I ordered the Norwegian burger with fries. They have a full bar. I think a park is being built across the street. over all ok place.

8QLcxfhOt6Aru3cuvi-ARg.text: Wow, wherever you do, avoid this place! Never been there before, and we walked I what I assume was a second door. The place was empty with the exception of a guy sitting at the bar with his back to us. There was no reaction such as a welcome or whatever, so I said "Hello." This rude guy finally acknowledged our presence. I asked if they were open. His response? You walked in, didn't you? He didn't tell us where the main dinging area was, so we just walked until we found it. My sister and I were talking about how rude he was. He followed us to our table very aggressively and yelled at us to leave. We were floored. He then went whining like a little girl to a woman behind the bar, who I assume was a manager. She attempted to calm him down and offered to seat us again. No thanks. Too many other restaurants around where they know how to treat customers. I think the little fellow had an extreme case of the Napoleon Complex. I will spread the word and discourage others from enduring what we endured there with that weird little man.

GXlwx8yrTNvT4u3pgAblZQ.text: Food was fantastic.  The place was pretty empty, but then again it was Monday.  I had the lamb burger and my colleague, a Brit, had the bangers and mash.  He said the sausage was the closest to British sausage he's ever had.  Great beer selection and the staff was very friendly.  I'd give it a 4.5 if I could.  It wasn't a 5, but the visit was better than a 4.  I highly recommend if you're looking for traditional pub food and a place to converse.

4HnURn9ZebY7Hz9RKKCvTA.text: Let me start by saying that our server, Joe, is amazing. If you're lucky enough to snag him, you won't be disappointed. We were a lively foursome and it was his first week of work! He rattled off the menu like an old pro.   Uptown on a rare Sunday evening landed us here after realizing we were too "seasoned" (aka Old) for the Ink and Ivy crowd. Glad we remembered the French Quarter area and stumbled upon this gem.   We were initially seated in the front. It was a tad tight for our taste and a friend realized there was more seating in the back area of the pub. Perfect! The four of us had that entire area to ourselves. Even though we were tucked away from the crowd, we were never forgotten.   Joe explained the drinks and I had one of the best glasses of Malbec ever; Joe suggested it and even brought the bottle for me to snap a picture. We also had a few tequila shots with very generous pours for the birthday guy we were celebrating.   I chose the Cajun shrimp wrap minus the lettuce and tomatoes and it was WONDERFUL! Joe was concerned the wrap might be too thin without the veggie trimmings but it wasn't. It has just enough heat and the shrimp were plentiful. Others at my table had wings that they also said were tasty.   Cute location in the heart of Uptown. Awesome customer service. Great food. You've got to check this spot out!

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Silver tequila
Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar in the back
Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hidden gem in the back part of the pub

368jz7mMVxfzDXRdSd7M_Q.text: Came to Valhalla for a work event & we were impressed.  Nice dark wood bar totally reminiscent of an English pub.  Skinny & cozy but fortunately we were in a separate room in the back  Dedicated bar & food brought out towards the end......was hoping they'd been a little quicker with the appetizers since most of the group had left before the food came out but it was still nice to have the separate room  And best of all was their totally worthy Oatmeal Porter!  Dark, creamy and went down too, too easy  We'll be back

7TSTaX_gOgRpudcCHJunfA.text: Cool spot in Charlotte French Quarter. Visited for a birthday bash and somewhat thought that the "quarter" in 'French Quarter' was referring to how incredibly small this area is. Charlotte's version is bite size compared to other cities but it does pack a stylish punch. We were set up in the back room so we could all sit together, about 20 of us. The two bartenders/servers were on point keeping drinks full and getting food orders, once we all arrived. The kitchen seemed over-whelmed, because the food was VERY scattered. Some of us received plates, finished our food and our plates were taken before others received theirs. I don't typically like to eat until everyone has been served, but that was a long differential.  Otherwise, Valhalla was incredibly accommodating and had some delicious beverage specials. It's also stationed below the Cotton Room, which is also INCREDIBLY SMALL, quaint maybe; but is convenient for the after party.

r55Z-mIsW81xMoWaKiu_hw.text: Before a knights game my family stopped at Valhalla. The place was pretty busy when we walked in and I thought "oh boy, it's gonna be a while before we get served." We were luck enough to grab a table and before we could even sit, had a server handing us menus, ready to take our order. Great service.  My son ordered the Ahi tuna, which he said was great. I wanted to try, but he ate them up to fast.  My wife is celiac and there's not much to offer a person here who's gluten free. So we ordered the chips and salsa. Unfortunately she got sick from what I assume was cross contamination in the fryer oil. Put a damper on the rest of our night because she wasn't feeling well.  It was our fault though. Should have been more careful.  This is the second time we've been to Valhalla and it's a cool bar in a hopping spot Uptown.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

XHAPDkgqcyjR8_T_0KR60w.text: I need to make a confession - I am not really a brunch person. I like breakfast to be before 9AM and the next meal to be a hearty lunch, so when we ventured to Valhalla and received menus I was anxious that at 10AM (special early opening for the soccer game) I would have to eat eggs again. I did not need to fret because even though it was early the waiter said their full menu was on service! For that reason alone this is now a contender for all soccer matches we see in the city.   I ordered the spiked lingonberry lemonade and it was light, refreshing and unique to the offerings of the bars nearby. If you go, don't be like me and ask for a straw. They are a straw free establishment due to environmental concerns. Cue moderate embarrassment on my part, and some difficulty navigating around the ice to get the last of my drink.   For my main I had the Swedish meatballs which were covered in robust gravy. The broccoli side was well steamed and the potatoes were delicious. It was also served with a side of toast which was a good vessel for the extra gravy.   The service was attentive and the food a great base for a day of sports and drinking. Worthy of a visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Meatballs

cIa0R-HT5EUHb0NeXlj03g.text: This was my first time at Valhalla and the atmosphere is very relaxing with a touch of Viking decor which was nice. I ordered a seafarer sandwich which was a Guinness battered haddock sandwich with a side of tarter sauce. The sandwich was delicious and the fish had really good flavor. I will say that it was busy during lunch and felt the service was a little less attentive(I sat with an empty glass of water for a hot minute). Overall I really enjoyed the restaurant and would go back. P.s. the 15% coupon from yelp is no longer accepted, I tried and failed.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seafarer

GNoj-dw6fOu1mk19R5Ltww.text: Popped in here after a networking event.  I had been here once before for a drink but never to sit down inside.    We started with drinks in the very back, I can't believe I didn't know this little room was there!  We eventually moved to tables to sit down for some apps.    We ordered the buffalo chicken dip and pretzel bites.  The dip was good as expected and the pretzels were amazing!  Not sure if it's because I  had a buzz and was starving but they were good!  So good we ordered a second plate.    I mainly had vodka and tonics while I was there and they perfect.  Our server was really nice and provided excellent service!   This place is great to have a drink before a sporting event and definitely perfect for a happy hour.  Not sure about their dinner but love the cocktail vibe they have.

QqJW6RFeJBJY6PuF4HqJZg.text: We visited Valhalla after Heroes Con on a Sunday night.  It was easy for us to find even though we are overly familiar with the area and it wasn't a bad walk from the convention center.  We were able to find a place to sit easily, which was nice.  It's not a huge place, but definitely big enough for a neighborhood pub.  The staff was friendly and checked in on us often.  I got the Cuban and green beans and was nearly able to finish it all.  There was so much meat on the sandwich that I had to give up (and I hadn't eaten lunch that day)!  The ambiance is definitely that of a friendly neighborhood pub.  There were plenty of groups of friends hanging out after watching some of the World Cup.  It wasn't overly loud or rowdy, we were able to carry on a conversation without having to raise our voices, which is always nice after a long day working at the convention.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cuban and green beans.

-SPJaBSa9mqQg-2gXV8cdw.text: We went here to watch the Liverpool finals.  The place was jammed packed wall to wall.     Obviously, It's difficult to gage the attentiveness of the staff or really anything on a day such as that.  What I can say is there were adequate televisions around, and blessedly they had the fans going to cool the crowd down.    They didn't have any beers that I wanted, and their prices were a bit inflated.  The ladies bathrooms smelled like a piss pot.    The wait staff was a bunch of snotty, blondes with funky looking shorts, wedged severely and probably painfully into their board-flat behinds, sneakers and a metric ton of trashy makeup.  In fairness they could have just had long hard days, with the huge influx of customers, but they all seemed to have resting bitch faces and attitudes to match.   There were cups, trash and plates of discarded food all over all of the tables.  Since there were kids all around someone could have gotten hurt.  I am not sure why no attempts were made to discard the dirty cups and plates.    Who knows perhaps I will go there on another day and have a different experience.  If that ever happens I will happily update my review.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Liverpool fans dealing with an upsetting defeat, while Rio Madrid fans celebrate

6XGgmXLHoxgzZQ9G8NKa6Q.text: The environment of Valhalla is everything.  It's the place you want to go before a ballgame, for happy hour, or before an uptown event!  They have a little patio area outside and window seats that have a view of the park!   I have gone for drinks a few times and always had good service.  Valhalla stays pretty crowded most of the time.    I went for lunch with 4 other people.   I ordered the buffalo chicken salad and it was pretty good.  The chicken is organic which is a nice plus.   There was also a lot of chicken on the salad!

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

5HBamCAaMhnTLbQZ47RBxg.text: We were just walking around for a place to grab a couple of drinks and quick bites before the baseball game and stumbled upon this place. We sat outside and the service was very quick! The food was so good and not too expensive. I had the cajun shrimp wrap and I'm still not over how good it was.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States

h2LzTJwrLZGf1A4FqNJh3Q.text: Valhalla is definitely a solid go to for lunch and happy hour. I've had their shrimp wrap, philly cheesesteak sliders (so good!), loaded fries etc. Everything has been pretty good, as well as their service! Really chill place.   I do wish they had better drink specials for happy hour but on the plus side, you can get 15% off your bill with a Yelp check-in!  Also to note, they no longer give straws with drinks (going more eco-friendly)... If you're like me, I definitely prefer using a straw. Some places who are choosing eco-friendly, are now investing in eco-friendly straws. However, Valhalla is not as of yet.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Loaded fries!

4aX8QSCy8plPZRgCq05D2g.text: Great place to grab a drink after work or before an event Uptown. Has a very chill pub feel but the food is always solid. Their grilled cheese hits the spot and can have the added pleasure of bacon tacked on as well for a small upcharge (worth it).

01RkJRPgiPwoe833FuFPiw.text: Small place, but had some good food. Went there when my wife was pregnant and she ordered the lychee iced tea. However, the waiter brought her the spiked lychee iced tea instead. Just a little miscommunication, but since my wife was pregnant it left a bad taste.

7gqpFsNLytWQGaESILFgqg.text: After spending a few hours walking around Charlotte on a quiet afternoon we started eyeballing restaurants to see which one struck our fancy.  My husband suggested Valhalla as we walked by and said he'd been once before and liked it so we went in.    I walked in and realized that if I ever owned a pub, this is the kind I'd want to own.  It's small and warm (meaning it's got lots of wood everywhere which gives it a cozy feel) and the bartender immediately acknowledged us as we entered and told us to sit anywhere we wanted.  I liked the vibe here immensely.  We chose a small booth and the chalk drawing of the skull glass caught my husband's eye, he loved it.  I took a pic for you to see.  There were two tv's with football games on but they weren't loud so you could follow along or not, as you chose.  We were quickly approached for a drink order by the bartender and when he went off to make them, a friendly server came over and asked us if we'd like a drink.  They are prompt and efficient here, for sure!  Drinks came and the server came back to see if we wanted food too (it was mid-afternoon) and we asked her for some recommendations.  She suggested Gmot's Grilled Chicken, Lodbrok's Lamb Burger, and Freya's Fish and Chips.  My husband had already spied the enormous deep fried haddock on a neighboring table's plate so he took her Fish and Chips recommendation. Light and crispy, it was the ultimate comfort food of Guinness battered haddock filet served on a bed of waffle fries with house made tartar sauce (that truly tastes housemade) and slaw.  $12.  I'd decided the Rollo's Pulled Pork Tacos sounded good this afternoon and received a plate of three well stuffed pork tacos, pulled pork made in house, in flour tortillas topped with cilantro and red cabbage slaw and drizzled with a chipotle blueberry BBQ sauce, also $12.  While good, they were need just a little bit of kick, maybe minced jalapeno?  I'm not sure, I couldn't put my finger on what I'd add.  Tacos don't come with any sides so I added some tater tots which were perfectly cooked (if you read my reviews you know I'm picky about using clean fry oil for fried foods).  These were perfectly done, in my book.  The food came out quickly, we'd only had about a third of our craft beers.  Service was consistently pleasant, and we had frequent check-ins by our server/I could see her looking over at our table to make sure all was well.    If I lived in walking distance of Valhalla, I'd quickly become a frequent patron.  I just really liked the coziness and friendliness of this pub.  I wish we had someplace like this up at Lake Norman!!  Stop in and give it a shot.  Definitely will revisit when I'm back down in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Table overlooking Latta Arcade.
Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. I just loved these cozy wood booths.
Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. The chalk drawing my husband thought was so funny.

QOMU9rBw2KoxKZ5zAk_nwg.text: My husband and I enjoyed a great late lunch at Valhalla Pub. We were at the Christmas Village but needed a more filling lunch so we wandered to Valhalla and we are so glad we did.   The waitress/bartender was so kind and efficient. We each ordered a drink - I had the Crabbie's Ginger Beer (YUM) and my husband enjoyed a Blue Blaze local brew.   I had the shrimp wrap which was delicious but maybe a bit sparse on shrimp. For under $10 with the Yelp check-in coupon, I was totally okay with this. My husband loved the fried chicken sandwich with pineapple. I tried a bite of the chicken and it was crispy and moist inside. Delicious.   We will certainly be back! Thanks for a great meal.

pULTNiNkehrg_6ZXmXQAgg.text: My bestie from college was in town on a layover and wanted to hang out.  I suggested that we hang out Uptown, because I immediately thought of Valhalla because I've always seen it but never had a chance to experience it.  This place is small, quaint and on a Thursday night around 8 p.m. it wasn't very busy.  I ordered the cheeseburger with tater tots.  ANY restaurant that serve tater tots is OK in my book!  The burger was well-seasoned and came with tomato, onion and lettuce.  I think there was a condiment spread on the bun, but I was too hungry to pay close attention to what it was.  My friends ordered the wings and the lamb burger.  They both agreed that it was delicious.  I sampled the buffalo wing with the wasabi ranch.  This is an awesome match!  You get the heat from the wing flavor and the kick from the wasabi.  Next, time I will try to be here for happy hour; which will probably be a little more crowded.  The service was excellent, the waitstaff was attentive and very accommodating with our questions.

DQQjfHbmYJ3ZhhlLbBoj_Q.text: Great service.  Perfect spot for a bite before a Knights game.  Outdoor seating area was nice.  Blueberry BBQ chipotle wings were the perfect blend of sweet and spicy...great wing sauce.  Banging Tots made a great starter...large serving.

VroQjL8ZbFkQCHQ0KxXk3A.text: Valhalla has a good selection of rotating local taps and comfortable seating. We came here on a Thursday night for a couple of rounds. The server was friendly and even knew the names of my local Charlottean friends. While they had stopped serving food at the time of our visit, the word on the street is they have pretty good food. Given the friendly service and comfortable vibe of this place, I wouldn't hesitate to come here earlier and have some food and a beer.

mt0GLnQHL6SSlEVuemJexQ.text: Best wings in America. Period. Chipotle blueberry and they are so incredibly tasty. Solid staff. Solid beer selections.

lrzGCEX60u5EbbHdXt6zFw.text: My skills at finding decent bars in town must be in decline in m old age....I've been traveling to Charlotte for work since July of last year and FINALLY found my spot in Brevard Court.    Valhalla is cool all around.  Friendly bartenders and tasty meatballs.   It's sort of an Indian/Norwegian fusion corner bar next to the few "real" bars in Charlotte.  I despise the touristy financial district so have been spending way too much money on cab rides exploring the south end, NoDa and Plaza Midwood.  This is much easier and is a common after work drinking hole place for the non-cheesy Charlotte workers.  I dig it.  The beer selection is a bit limited but the owners can pull from Vintage Wine Shop as well.   Never had a bad meal there....craving those meatballs with curry as I write this actually.    Not sure if this counts as ironic, but I saw an old episode of Frasier the other day where Niles is discussing the new "hot" restaurant in town....an Indian/Norwegian fusion place.   I was like, holy shit, that place actually exists.  Definitely worth checking out.

Hezu1Y-m6C-fahynavyH4Q.text: Such a fan.  One of the few places open on a quiet bank holiday uptown, I am so happy we stopped in. Everything on the menu looked great: wings to burgers, bangers and mash to salmon... The only thing missing was a turkey leg (which some had while watching a soccer game on a previous visit).   The Norsk burger was a big hit (how can it not be with that thick slice of bacon and fried egg?), I LOVED my drunken chicken (I really thought I would be in need of a condiment, but that pineapple did an excellent job), the triple grilled cheese was tasty, and the bangers and mash hit home. Of course the waffle fries were awesome (who doesn't like waffle fries?) and the wings were quoted as being some of the "best (they'd) ever had".   Delish cider, good beers on tap, and a good amount of tvs to catch any game, I'll be back!

ms4xDD3u1ihqg9VD5awk_A.text: Had a delicious brunch here. Food was reasonably priced and our waitress was very nice. I highly recommend the spiked lingonberry lemonade! It's a great cocktail for brunch, or anytime really. We went home later and made some more!

GBBgHaWi_JxT0NJhCY5_UA.text: Great pub and local beer selection. We stopped in for local beers and apps. Plenty of NC draft beers to choose from and bbq pulled pork nachos are fantastic.

_vySCGxC14xrru9MvZ7yiQ.text: This place is great!  5 days in Charlotte, 4 Meals at ValHalla!  The food is well prepared.

YyHMwI-nptE6rSqVFb28tQ.text: Khenary and Dana make the best Margaritta's in the world.  The watermelon is refreshing and delightful.  The staff is very friendly and welcoming to all.  I also had the smoked salmon and capers and it was delicious.  The trio of the French Quarter, Valhalla and Hooligans gives you a small town feel in the middle of the city.    Check out Brevard court on the corner of MLK and Church.

-F1T0WHppFJCnpEwuqCkmw.text: I waffled between three and four stars, but ultimately I have to give Valhalla props for an affordable Uptown lunch that was pretty good.  I was hoping for something a little more... substantial. The whole Nordic thing really comes off as more of a "theme" than anything. I was hoping to experience Nordic food in the same way one might expect to experience Thai food at a Thai restaurant. I could have gone to IKEA for the same level of authenticity - although the heavy timber trim was a nice touch.  Having said that, the food was still good and the staff was very friendly. Given how increasingly rare under-$10 lunches are, I see myself heading back here.

nNKMn9HzHuHXTjvhPuFQDQ.text: Went for lunch today and ordered the Norweigian burger and Laghertha's Turkey Sandwich. As expected, the Norweigian burger lived up to the previous reviews. It was juicy, flavorful, and the red onions gave it a great crisp taste. Between my girlfriends lunch and mine however, the Laghertha's Turkey sandwich was the winner. The aioli sauce and the crunch of the apple with the turkey was divine. Definitely the best we've had in Charlotte yet.

5whRQNYMWo8lnh7kWu0Xpg.text: I came across this little bar one day walking around Charlotte. I love this place. The food is awesome and the staff is always friendly. It's small and personal. It's the perfect bar for those who hate Chain bars and restaurants. It's in the perfect location right across from the new Knight stadium and near the Panther stadium.

l7ohhYJrmatMVnpWU03AZA.text: Valhalla has become our go-to bar in uptown Charlotte. Great and seasonally changing beer list, a good by-the-glass wine list and surprisingly terrific food. The indoor space is fun and exactly what a bar should be--the outdoor seating along Brevard court is awesome. But the best part is the staff; knowledgable, helpful, and after just a couple of visits are likely to know your name and drink. On game days the place is crazy but the staff maintains their equanimity and gets your drink out to you as soon as humanly possible. Love this place!

VE7KAVlLQ4Pg_EmsezSRMQ.text: Standard pub fare that is way overpriced.  spent $29 for a salad & a sandwich.

UVzD0iLJabUicDPfAfA4vw.text: Valhalla Pub was.. okay. My family and I ate there before a Knights game because it is conveniently close to the stadium. Their menu is small and very "meat"-friendly. It was also filled with pretty unhealthy options, something I like to avoid. I finally decided on the buffalo chicken salad with habanero dressing. I'm normally able to handle extremely spicy foods but the dressing ended up being way too much for me. The waitress did not warn me, or check to see if the food was okay. I couldn't even finish the salad because my mouth burned so much. Mind, the pub was super busy and our waitress seemed to be handling most of the tables on her own. It was also very loud, which I didn't mind, but others may want to pass. It's convenient if you're attending a Knights game, but other than that, I won't go back.

dL3bSShALVzO-O0zyQ09AQ.text: I loved everything here. They have a great selection of quality micro-brews, as well as tasty, freshly squeezed juices for their drinks. The service was friendly and prompt, and the atmosphere is great for anyone wanting the more "local" feel of Charlotte.

G4e6IU65rZknE9wsHeHSYA.text: Food is amazing try the fish and chips it is to die for a large piece of fried fish on a bed of waffle fries so yummy.

fR1Kcy36vyUlye7vEBLGYw.text: I love Valhalla.  I really do.  The owners are awesome & the food is always spot on.  It's a great hidden place to get lunch uptown & also a great place to catch a bite after work or a show.  You can sit in the Courtyard & enjoy your food as well.   I'm partial to the Norsk burger, a mix of sausage & beef, a fried egg & norsk sauce & it's flippin' amazing.  The fish sandwich is seriously bigger than the plate, the curry sauce is perfect & the new chicken sandwich is the perfect lunch size.    I kid you not my boyfriend, who works across the street, eats here 3x a week for lunch, I can't tear him away from the place.

S9l_I3dmIfjUYHyEAL0ihw.text: This place is fantastic!! Never could complain about anything that has come out of their kitchen. The food is awesome!!! Plus freshly squeezed fruits as mixers in your cocktails say whaaaa!!! The place is dope!!

FCWc1ntfqXmfKC4iDUIpqQ.text: Holy cow, the blackened Cajun shrimp is amazing. I wasn't planning to eat the toast, but I had to use it to soak up the glorious sauce.

XIT6bYfXlaxrTsTs7xD5Xg.text: The pot roast was amazing! Casual environment, not super busy, very nice place to relax. Went for dinner on a Saturday night around 8. Service was decent, attentive without being overbearing, and he was very honest when we asked for his opinion. We will definitely be back!

ctvKVXHo7dQHVe4e9ZzPJA.text: You guys, they are updating their menu and had a "Lamb Burger with Feta and Curry Mayo" to try as a special that they are adding.  It. Was. Awesome.  Seriously, so tasty.  You need to go here, and get that burger, and then die of happiness.  Been here several times, and although service is a tad slow during lunch, they're always very friendly and the food is great, so I don't mind.  ALSO - check in on Yelp... you'll be glad you did :)

pcAqjAoV5R6p5hGuHA_cGw.text: Vahallas is pretty good. The fried pickles are meh but the pretzel bites are really good. The spicy bloody Marys are amazing unless it's the World Cup, then they make them so you breathe fire, but otherwise they're really good & they come with shrimp. The food is good though & the atmosphere is fun & the staff is great!

TfyNKV2IdbwXp1mXpF95lg.text: I just wasn't overly impressed.  First of all, the limited menu had about two things I was interested in. The selection was not superb. It was a Knights game. I understand using a limited menu for Panthers games, but if using a limited menu for Knights games that happen five times a week it doesn't allow much opportunity to see what else is on the menu.  My turkey wrap was decent. But just decent. It was very hot and crowded, which I know is the thing there. I live a block away so I will probably come back I just maybe want to try something different.  Oh yeah and the Moscow mules were 12 bucks and didn't even come in a copper mug, so that's a total rip off.

7BQV2-quBIB0a01U8zceJw.text: This place might come off as a pub first and foremost, but it seems to take food very seriously. I only tried a few to-go Viking burgers during a brief trip to downtown Charlotte, and they were really good. Service could have been better. Even for to-go orders when the bag was right there on the counter and like no one at the bar, it took about as long as a packed dance club bartender to be noticed and rung (ringed?) up.

AR5xJsL2R5PUlrMRGuL0TQ.text: After walking aimlessly through uptown on our first trip to Charlotte we finally took shelter in the comfort of Valhalla Pub. We were new to the town, and had no idea what kind of place this would be. After our first visit this has quickly become one of our favorite spots in Uptown!   It's a very fun, casual environment, with awesome decor. The waitstaff is always very friendly and helpful. It's a pub, so the service isn't quick. But, if you are going to just enjoy your time, it's well worth the wait.   We got the grilled cheese sandwich and black bean burger. Both were fantastic! Delicious food, and a great beer selection. What more can you ask for?

3f0FnVQw-sMLmmYsdEE7LA.text: I think this place is worth checking out, partly because the courtyard is cool, overall.  As Charlotte infrastructure builds up around it, this area will continue to get more unique.  Valhalla is the best restaurant I've been to in this area.  Just solid bar food,  good place to hang out.

fX2X0NPniS7OzhBRdplH6g.text: Valhalla Pub had a fun atmosphere & tasty food.  In case you couldn't tell from the name, Valhalla Pub is Scandinavian & Viking themed. Being Danish, I really enjoyed the atmosphere. The walls are covered with Nordic flags.  Great meatballs & nice beer selection.  The next time I am in Charlotte, I will definitely go back to Valhalla for some beer & food.

c9paBPnv53a_sniG25ZPVw.text: If Valhalla is Viking heaven thank this place is Charlotte pub hell. Food was mediocre pub grub and that's being generous. Service was dreadful. We waited almost 45 minutes for wings, while the first appetizer we ordered came out after about fifteen minutes. Waitress was friendly in manner but not in actions. When I asked for silverware she loudly pointed out that it was on the other side of the table and why had i not seen it?   People at a table next to us so I didn't take them an hour to get what they ordered. Lest you think it was crazy busy it was 5 o'clock on a Saturday, not really all that busy.  There are a lot of restaurants in this area, surely one of them is better than this.

0jY6VEcSLBMQRFaKlaBSpA.text: This place is great. The sangria is the best in town and the vibe in there makes it one of my favorite after work spots

vyJiCxjnkERLnDaZQmBCUQ.text: The ONLY negative I can say about this little jewel is they had a Liverpool banner hanging. Good staff (while a bit short-handed), great beer selection, and not only a proper fish and chips but one of the best I have ever had. Glad we found you, we will ABSOLUTELY be back!

GSNZ7Ru2V8g6MNlVlNyg6Q.text: Every time I'm down in Charlotte to see my parents I love going to Valhalla. They have both an excellent drink selection, featuring many local taps, as well as amazing food. Today I had their Ahi Tuna Sandwich, which was a special and was fantastic. My usual go to is their Lagertha sandwich, which has turkey and apples in it. The interior is cozy and welcoming, and it makes you feel like a True Nord. As the sign on the wall says, "the problem with society is that nobody drinks from the skulls of their enemies anymore!"

G1rdZbNYH4kDO1y0cgwJ_w.text: Visiting Charlotte from NJ, as soon as my friends and I entered we were welcomed with a warm greeting.  We were seated where ever we choose. The servers told us of the specials and showed us one as well that looked stellar, but we came for brunch.   I had the northern eggs Benny, it was amazing really hit the spot. My two friends got the warriors omelette and they said it topped any jersey diner omelette they ever had.   We asked for some sites to hit in the city, and even busy with the lunch rush they wrote down some sites to see and gave us the directions to get there.   There micro brew selection was solid as well.  You will not be disappointed here.

JyZDP5H5BJu1UHoAkYYTPw.text: Good for lunch. A great variety of food with a good atmosphere. Close to both stadiums so makes it a great pre or post game stop. If you are looking for a small bar with good food, this place is it.

fZeh-eJXoMGKvhLgQKVhvA.text: Pub food with a viking twist. Perfect burgers and a very friendly group of servers. Valhalla is a bit small but worth a wait.

6yhI9BnusxIbcYpEgp5VGw.text: This place was a cool spot to start the night . It's in a great location , with several other cool bars and eateries very close by . The wings and buffalo salad were good . Be careful with the spicy ranch it really sneaks up on you , after taste very spicy and I like spicy but this was different . The meatball plate was ok , they really weren't what I expected , there were more sausage patty style and not my favorite bite . A lot of beer to choose from

O0yUO9HS0sZ5EYT7QaEDWQ.text: I've been here twice now, and the food never disappoints even during the busy lunch rush, and especially after!  See most places uptown, the quality suffers after the lunch rush or they run out of items.  Anywho... Valhalla is the perfect lunch spot if you're looking for something heavy to coat your stomach before after work drinks, just want a wholesome warm lunch, or want a fresh salad.  I've had the lamb burger and the chicken sandwich.  My husband got the seafarer sandwich and it was amazing!  I love that they make their sauces in house, because I'm a sauce queen and they get five stars just off the strength of having great sauces.  The food is so fresh, and you know it was made to order!  The servers are attentive, and pleasant.  After eating all that heavy food, you'll need to walk it down around the perimeter of Romare Bearden which is right across the street.  If you're going to a Knights game, Panthers game, or out drinking this is the place to fill up before a big night.  I can't wait to go back and try the wings next time, and I'll take some pics.

MGPug6oEQXjRXGFsjMqVeA.text: So I was down in the park today and got really hot and thirsty and looked around for somewhere close to pop in get a a beverage and maybe a bite to eat.  What a great find!  If you are looking for a "family friendly" place this can be that but it is more of a "hanging out" place.  A place to sit around with friends have a few beers and some great food.  I had a bloody mary that I thought was pretty overpriced since almost everyone has bloody mary specials on sundays but what the heck.  I had the turkey sandwich with apple cheese and bacon and it was excellent!  And yummy real mashed red potatoes!  Very friendly staff.  I would definitely drop in again!

lYmXL9FiDZDuS2jIngqdeQ.text: I liked the place well enough. Good beer selection although it took forever to get our beers after we ordered despite not being that busy. The beers came in plastic Dixie cups instead of regular pint glasses so a little on the cheap side there. There was a mountain of trash stacked up AGAINST the windows so if you turned around to enjoy the view of the park, you just saw oozing trash bags. The place smelt stale. Food was ok but even the main dishes had small portions. I got the bratwurst and it was good enough. Just passing through the area so doubt after my first impression, that I'll come back next time I'm in town.

2nngLsd-Fn4inCcEOYWXLQ.text: Get the Norweigan burger--it is pretty darn good.  Came here for Friday lunch with colleague of mine.  We both ordered the Norweigan burger-I did so based on friend's recommendation.  It doesn't disappoint.  It's like a sub roll with seasoned ground beef/chicken combination with veggies and amazing cheese.  Definitely want to grab lunch here again at some point.  I like the place.  Looks clean and has a nice lil theme to it.  Since I came in the daytime, couldn't tell what it's like at night, but the French Quarter area(?) of uptown Charlotte seems like a hip little place to hang out.  Not there there's a lot of bars or anything but seems quaint and a little low-key.  Who knows, maybe it's poppin' like the Epicentre.  Pet peeve:  finished meal wait for check, server drops off check, and disappears for ten minutes, picks up the check and disappears again for ten minutes, returns with our change.  I don't know about you but I hate the whole process and how long it takes.  I think the gap between dropping off the check and picking up the check takes way too long generally--but I can see how some people like to just eat, get the check, and sit there...I like to slip them the credit card, the minute the bill comes--kinda speeds up the process. ::Rant mode off:   They were uber-slow in that respect.  dmo out.

xAq4U4c3aKMWDpivNnVPBw.text: I love this place! It's in uptown Charlotte, NC in the French quarter. And across from the new park that plays live music on weekends, and close to the new BallPark.   Good Sunday brunch. Had the veggie hash!  I always get the smoked Salmon with capers so so good!! Staff is friendly! And always has a crowd.

21MgJGDrkt-r0jEZTdFr0g.text: Rude. Rude. Rude. I took my kids to eat on a Thursday afternoon. The service was awful. We had 3 different people occasionally show up to take our order, deliver food ...clearly they didn't give a shit but I gave them the benefit of the doubt because the food was marginal & the seats were nice. I took my kids, ages 9 & 10 to the bathroom & when we came back, out food was cleared & people were sitting at our table! We had waited forever for a refill of soda & finally got it, got up to go the the bathroom & they threw everything out, including my bottled water. I complained but they were not apologetic at all. I left no tip, put on a good face for my kids & left. The manager had zero personality, appeared to be pissed off about something when we showed up. This place sucks. Such a waste of a great location!

hWGb03ja4MpUNroIMjgVhQ.text: I had to try Valhalla specifically do to Pourina's review.  I am also a huge fan of burgers with a gooey egg on top.  The Norske burger is easily the best hamburger I've had in a long, long, time!  The pork/beef mixture and the egg with bacon and Norske sauce make for a great experience of flavor regardless of the time of day.  I didn't play around with my beer selection much.  Just a few Guinness.  I'm not sure if I found it funny or pretty cool that my Guinness head had a barista style clover swirled into it...hell...I'll give it two thumbs up.  Lastly, the service was great and the decor...ah...who really cares...it was comfortable.  This is exactly what I'd expect from a neighborhood bar.  If I lived closer to Valhalla, I'd hang out here.

PS6Wzn093oh07rR6RyYb-A.text: Came in here looking for some Lutfisk, or fermented herring. The didn't have a single rotting fish on the menu. My Norseman's nose told me that they didn't have a single decaying shark in the back kitchen either.  However, my disappointment led to delight when I saw that they had all kinds of burgers that would make a viking proud. I got one that was topped with a fried egg on top. How Scandinavian is that?! The burger was filling and delicious. It came with fries, which didn't look like they were straight from Oslo, but still pretty good.  I enjoyed the fact that they have a great location at the front of an old-timey food court and mall. There's plenty of bicycle parking out in front, along with a nice little "parklett" that you can take your food to go.  The interior looks like someone raided an old barn and tacked up the siding all on the walls, giving it a rustic feel.  They serve a variety of beers, including some local craft beers.  The service was good, and the place was clean.  In the restrooms, check out the sink- it looks like a mystical whiskey barrel that you can use to wash your hands. If this is what Valhalla feels like, I'm gunna need a Viking Funeral when I die!

QAv4Ttb978q0VQGWh4KrlA.text: This place closes early on weekdays ! Very disappointed! Make sure to call before arrival.

E_FauEMcrxK-M-y85r1Nuw.text: "Exceptional."  For me, it's the only word I can think of to describe my dining experience.  I was walking by this restaurant, minding my own business and I noticed a waiter walking to a table with a tater tots and chicken wrap of some kind, impeccably plated. I had to investigate this further.  I ordered the Seafarer Sandwich and Tater Tots. While I was waiting for my food I noticed what some of my fellow patrons ordered. Their food, not only looked delicious but each dish appeared consistently immaculate in its presentation.  When my food arrived, not only look fantastic, but it tasted even better. I had to let my server know and for him to let his management know that my visit to their establishment was outstanding and they far exceeded my expectations!

xozHI4-gfuzzJ_LRhP7nDw.text: I consistently have great food at Valhalla. Some of my favorites are the Cajun shrimp wrap and the blueberry barbecue wings. They also have a great beer selection and the low key ambiance makes this a great after work happy hour spot!

LyOJqACGZ2vP4WabtG3fGw.text: It's tough to review this place. I once got the Norwegian Burger and never looked back. It is the only thing I order there. I have cravings for it. I can't even tell you what else is on the menu. The beef is not as flavorful as some other places like Clover Joes a few place down, but everything else they throw on it still makes this one of the best in my opinion. Maybe one day I'll branch out. It just doesn't seem like I need to.

LrJPJ5eHrgcC9vZoW5shEQ.text: Great bar food, great atmosphere, outdoor seating, next to park, right near baseball stadium.  A lot to like...one if my favorites uptown.

gkrHJH9ts0Mz1P3zmecN0g.text: Most amazing pub food in Uptown Charlotte!!!  How highly recommend Chicken Quesadilla during happy hour (spicy sauce is spicy!), English Breakfast & Cuban Sandwich...tater tots are also a must!

8pGHfC1av9mg7kEWtbryjw.text: Great service. Excellent "hidden" bourbon list. Food was decent. Location is great. Definitely would go back.

zPxsYb6WLrFVcTSctylyWw.text: Best kept secret in Charlotte!! Food is always fresh & delicious, great selection of craft beers, outdoor seating & wonderful, friendly staff. Salads are amazing & so are the wraps...with tots of course. Great selection of discounted appetizers from 5-7pm nightly!! It's a cozy bar atmosphere inside so if you're looking for quiet...this isn't your spot.

X0CKslrWXF8y5L4Vwyto7w.text: This place is solid and a good spot to have at the opening to Brevard Court. They have a variety of drinks and food options, with the Berserker's Breakfast being my favorite. The only thing holding my review back from 5 stars is the crowd. The staff does a great job serving everybody at crowded times in an efficient manner, but Valhalla has a magnet for the most annoying patrons in Brevard Court. Maybe it's because they are in front and provide a buffer for some of the places further down the alley that don't have annoying patrons. I'll keep going to Valhalla because the pros way outweigh the cons and will just continue to build up my resistance to terrible people who act like they are experiencing a drink for the first time or make demands like you would only see at a place that offers bottle service.

qzqnps_AOC9LWrD1mB2yEw.text: I have a confession. I went here and ordered food, without even glancing at Yelp...  I know! I know! I didn't even read reviews on the Norwegian burger, and now I feel left out. I got a burger, it was on long French bread (different, neat idea) but the burger was flat and over cooked. The waffle fries were crunchy though, exactly how I like them. Just not super impressive.   The saving grace for this place was their ability to handle the crowd just before Fan Fest. We walked inside, and were able to get beers pretty quickly. I was probably a half hour away from the hangry zone - so we easily grabbed a table. (Plan ahead, avoid hangry! Success!) it was my first time here and I really liked the feel of the place. We were so anxious about getting food and over to the Stadiium, that I didn't look at my Yelp app. The food was ok. But the service was fast and ambiance was cool. 3 stars. I'll update after I go back and try the Norwegian burger, hopefully that will raise the rating.

FUu5ZzcIg1QXDYhVb0b4Ig.text: Limited menu Really good northern eggs Benedict Great service  Dead. Word not out.  Great find.

A8NS6nAwKTN80LEvb8OC6Q.text: Their breakfast is the shit!!!! They only serve it on weekends, but OMG so good. Make it a cheat day so you can have the eggs, crispy potatoes, thick cut bacon, and eggs with swiss on top. The toast is some of the best bread I've had. Waitress was cool and knowledgeable, and attentive. I have to admit, I wanted a traditional brunch in a "nice" place, but I'm so glad I stayed. My bf and I both agreed it was one of the best breakfasts we've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bezerker&#39;s breakfast. Omg.

PJ6lSdBfQD6T0bSRBlg_-Q.text: Big fan of this place!   We came here on Friday evening after a concert in Uptown. There really isn't an actual parking lot....though, that isn't exactly an issue for us since we live in Uptown and walk everywhere!  The bartenders are great. One of the female bartenders asked our names and for the entire night called us by name......I like that personal touch. She was making a margarita and my husband and I were talking abt how we wondered what it tasted like (it had some weird ingredient in it). The bartender overheard us and made a little extra for us to try a taste! That kind of service is what keeps customers coming back!  We ordered the loaded fries with pot roast.......yeah, I know, not that great for you.....but man, it was amazing!!! The loaded fries had ham, pot roast, cheese, corn, and jalapenos on them. If you are going to break a diet, this is the ONLY way to do it!   Will obviously be coming back for great food, amazing service, and cold beers!

QSBvJnVJFDKJCY7PcTOlMA.text: I wish I took a picture but their smoked salmon plate was amazing. The service was good, their bloody Mary's were good. My only problem is that when we came there the next day before football game, all the tables were occupied and I needed lunch before he game. However, the bartenders did not take orders at the bar because "they wouldn't be able to serve everyone." We took our drinks and took our business elsewhere. I will definitely be back but probably not on a game day.

dbqXf0nGhQZfIijtjCPp2Q.text: If there were half stars this place would be more like a 3.5. The atmosphere and food are pretty good here. I've had the fish and chips once and wings another time. Good local beer menu as well. The things that make this place less than a 4 are the lack of menu options and that there really isn't anything unique or overly exciting about the food. The bartender that served us seemed like he hated his job. He was not personal at all and literally would drop the food off and never come back to ask how things were. Several times we were sitting with empty beers and it was not a busy night. Might stop by for a drink if I'm in the area bar hopping but not a go-to bar for me by any means. Just meh.

hX2Q0wFGRPJ19nXNFTKV3Q.text: We didn't eat, but as an observer the food looked great smelled great, and everyone in the place was devouring everything on their plates.  Awesome spot before a game, great drink/beer selection, and really good service.  Great atmosphere and really cool shirts, if you are into the whole viking thing.  I loved it, and this is my spot when I return to Charlotte.

Z6AOIRH7XtX_rcf25NaGrA.text: We visited Valhalla before a Knights baseball game on a Friday night. I was skeptical it would be too crowded and loud to enjoy dinner and was not expecting the service to be great because of the crowd. I was pleasantly surprised! The service was excellent and the food was great. The atmosphere was loud but nothing out of control. Overall, great experience!

YYduRyWS01uTxLnHgRg22A.text: Great service, best we have had in town! Server made an amazing watermelon drink, thank you! Wide selection of food, everyone was pleased with what they got!   Check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Watermelon drink!

IxqQiX8EhvfKsv2gHKD_SQ.text: If you're looking for brunch, this is no longer your spot. They have done away with their brunch menu recently due to the fact that they could not accommodate large game day crowds. This is unfortunate, and I expect they will need to put brunch back on the menu soon because it was very popular.  However, the bartender was extremely friendly and accommodated by allowing my friend and I to order from their old brunch menu. This happened after I mentioned that their website still advertised Saturday and Sunday brunch. I ordered the Norwegian Eggs Benedict, which was fantastic. The food was good! Their Bloody Marys were decent. I think they got busy and forgot to put some of the extras in our drinks (ex pickled asparagus, even though there was a jar sitting on the bar top). Overall: A great experience, fantastic location, friendly staff, good food, decent prices. I will definitely be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Valhalla Pub and Eatery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Viking Bloody Mary
